title: Social Media Intern
description:
**ABOUT AURA**



Aura’s mission is to create products that bring people closer together through photos, videos, and memories. We’re the leading brand in WiFi-connected digital picture frames, with a range of products ranked #1 by Wirecutter, The Strategist, WIRED, and Oprah. Featuring a crystal-clear display, seamless software updates, and a user-friendly app, Aura makes it easy for loved ones to share and display their favorite photos and videos in frames that complement any home decor.



Headquartered in New York City, our team consists of data-driven, creative, and forward-thinking collaborators focused on delivering the highest quality digital frames on the market. We value innovation, and consistently experiment with new technology and product offerings to ensure our customers always have the most enjoyable photo-sharing experience.



This genuine love for the product, combined with our commitment to our customers, has fostered sustainable and profitable growth. Today, Aura frames display billions of photos worldwide, bringing people closer together wherever they are.

  


**ABOUT THE INTERNSHIP**


* *NYC based with the ability to go into the office 1-2 times per week as needed.*
* *20 hours/week*
* *September 30, 2024 - January 10, 2025*

  


**ABOUT THE ROLE**



Aura is seeking a part-time dynamic and creative Social Media Intern to help grow and maintain our organic social media presence. Under the guidance of the Senior Copywriter, you will be responsible for curating and managing content across our Instagram and TikTok accounts. This role is perfect for someone who is passionate about social media, has a keen eye for design, and is eager to learn about the world of consumer tech and digital photo frames.  

  

  



**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**


* **Content Creation & Scheduling:** Develop, design, and schedule engaging content for Instagram and TikTok, ensuring alignment with Aura’s core mission and goals.
* **Community Engagement:** Monitor and respond to comments, messages, and interactions on Tiktok.
* **Trend Research & Implementation:** Stay current on the latest social media trends and cultural zeitgeist and creatively implement them into Aura’s organic content strategy.
* **Analytics & Reporting:** Track and analyze key performance metrics, providing regular reports on the effectiveness of social media campaigns and suggesting improvements.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS**


* Ability to creatively elevate, engage, and communicate the brand message across Instagram and Tiktok.
* Experience in creating and managing content calendars.
* Proficient in tracking and reporting on social media performance metrics.
* Excellent grammar, spelling, writing, and communication skills.
* Skilled in Photoshop or other photo/video editing applications.
* Comfortable working in Google Docs and other collaborative tools.
* Previous experience with social media management is a plus.


**Compensation and Benefits**



At Aura, we believe in creating a happy and supportive work environment so you are set up to succeed in your job and do the best work of your career, whether in person or remotely or both. We have offices in New York City, San Francisco, and Shenzhen, China, and our employees also work remotely across the U.S. and around the world. We offer the following benefits to Aura interns based in the U.S.:


* Lunch and snacks and snacks on us every day in our NYC offices
* Compensation: $25 - $30 per hour, commensurate with experience

title: Office Manager
description:
Provide support for program activities and assists with various resident-related functions in the facility. Provides administrative support to staff as needed.

**Responsibilities:**


Maintain active resident caseload.


Ensure that all resident and program supplies are in stock, and reorder as needed.


Assist with special events and activities for clients.


Assists with preparation of monthly reports to DHS and other reports as necessary.


Writes, transcribes, maintains and distributes minutes of meetings. Maintains the appointment calendar for the PD.


Answer/Screen calls for PD.


Responsible for ordering and maintaining inventory for all office supplies, clients clothing.


Responsible for submitting all check request from all vendors.


The position requires H.S. Diploma or equivalent and related clerical/secretarial experience. Computer skills such as proficiency with Microsoft Word and Excel as required. Needs the ability to establish workload priorities and balance diverse project. Must have exceptional oral and written communication skills pertaining to individuals and groups regarding complex and sensitive issues or regulations. Physical abilities to perform the essential job functions are needed. In addition, the Office Manger shall perform any duties as required to meet the needs of the program/services and the clients we serve. The agency reserves the right to review and change job duties and responsibilities as the need arises. This job description dos not constitute a write or implied contract of employment.

title: Substance Abuse Counselor
description:
**Title:** CASAC Counselor
  
**Reports to:** Clinical Program Director
  
The CASAC Counselor will conduct services within the PREP Center. CASAC counselor is responsible for the
  
delivery of substance abuse and relapse prevention counseling services within the residential unit.
  
The CASAC Counselor will document all services within AWARDS electronic records and billing system within 24
  
hours of service date. Documentation includes progress notes on all services, screening tools, service plans, intake
  
assessment forms, group sign-in forms and group notes.
  
  

**The CASAC Counselor responsibilities include:**  

Conduct pre-intake client screenings
  
Conduct alcohol and other drug withdrawal and drug use assessments and screenings
  
Complete a comprehensive assessment on each client
  
Maintains and coordinates a client caseload
  
Provide individual and group counseling
  
Document all client care services and maintain chart documentation, paperwork for referring agencies and outside
  
support services
  
Conducts client orientation and discharge planning for clients
  
Coordinate care with external and internal providers/resources (i.e. court appointments,
  
medical procedures, parole/probation)
  
In coordination with clinical team develop and implement a substance abuse and/or relapse prevention
  
treatment plan for the client.
  
Develop and implement a substance abuse /relapse prevention and recovery related group curricula
  
Attend all appropriate meetings, participate in appropriate case conferences, treatment plan meetings
  
Supervise clients adherence to program rules and regulations
  
Perform various other tasks and responsibilities as appropriate and required
  
Perform necessary follow-up on clients' request for outside appointments, phone calls, home visits.
  
Also responsible for discussing client outside activities as they relate to the clients' sobriety and or
  
relapse.
  
  

CASAC or CASAC-T (pending CASAC certification) with HSD/GED or comparable credentials such as MSW,
  
MHC, LMSW, LMHC required.
  
A thorough understanding of the disease of addiction and the impact it can have on the lives of our clients.
  
Knowledge of motivational interviewing and the stages of change as well as person-centered practices.
  
Theoretical knowledge of a clients psychological and physical needs and an understanding of group work
  
practices and principles needed.
  
Experience with OASAS portal, HCS, and LOCADTR process
  
Ability to work with Culturally Diverse, LGBTQ, HIV and homeless population
  
Knowledge of OASAS 822 outpatient program a plus.

title: Case Manager
description:
**Work Schedule:** Full time,Monday-Friday 9am-5pm

**SUMMARY:**


The Case Manager will be responsible for implementing, monitoring, and ongoing assessments of the social service plans for clients that come into the Drop-In Center.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Assess, triage, and provide supportive services and referrals for homeless persons that enter the Drop-In Center including substance abuse treatment, medical needs, housing needs, and vocational needs.
* Complete, in a timely fashion, all necessary paperwork, including intake forms, psycho-social assessments, daily logs, and statistical reports.
* Assist clients in completing entitlement applications, scheduling, and following through with necessary appointments.
* Facilitate groups with clients of the Drop-In Center.
* Monitors client's medication regime as needed.
* Assist client in developing ADL skills.
* Facilitate group client escorts as needed.
* Respond to medical, psychiatric, and other emergencies on an as-needed basis.

**Qualifications Needed:**

* Bachelors's degree is required.
* Two years of case management experience, working with the homeless population preferred.
* Needs the ability to establish workload priorities and balance a diverse caseload.
* Clean valid driver's license required.
* Must have exceptional communication skills both orally and in writing with individuals and groups regarding complex and sensitive issues or regulations.
* Identify long-term/permanent housing opportunities as outlined by funding source to homeless adults who have been living on the streets many of whom have a mental illness and substance abuse issues that meet the level 1 and level 2 placement criteria
* Meet with clients on a regular basis and develop strategies with clients in order to identify clients current housing needs
* Secure entitlements on all clients identified for Level 1 and Level 2 placements in order to develop housing plans in conjunction with the Team
* Will complete expedited individualized housing plans on those clients identified for Level 1 and Level 2 placements in order to meet and receive milestone payment and objective
* Guide homeless clients in learning about permanent housing opportunities and assist in completing their housing applications on those clients identified for Level 1 and Level 2 placement
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with housing providers. Act as liaison between agencies, clients and prospective housing providers. Establish relationships with realtors and private landlords in order to meet the milestone objectives of the contract
* Will complete subsidized housing applications on all clients who meet the criteria for Section 8 and HRA housing programs in an expedited manner in order to meet and receive milestone objectives/ and payment incentive to HS
* Provide advocacy and follow up on all applications submitted to Section 8 and HRA
* Conduct ongoing housing searches on all clients that have been identified for Level 1 and level 2 placement in order to ensure the program meets the annual milestone incentive goals
* Make referrals to special housing agencies for those with unique needs
* Prepare client for housing interviews, using motivational interviewing techniques
* Escort clients to interviews, view apartments, meet prospective landlords and real estate brokers.
* Ensure acceptance into appropriate housing programs
* Participate and attend the Interdisciplinary Team and Administrative meetings weekly.
* Submit all monthly reporting in a timely manner


This position requires a Bachelors Degree and/or previous housing experience working with housing disadvantaged populations. The successful candidate will have significant experience working with clients on issues of homelessness, entitlements, addiction, mental illness, and/or special needs housing. Should have at least two years experience working within the New York City housing market or homeless services system, and familiarity with housing and entitlement systems and procedures. Candidates should possess demonstrable writing and communication skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and facilitation abilities, including the ability to work effectively with staff from other organizations and agencies. Computer proficiency is required. Bi-lingual English/Spanish is preferred. Must possess a clean and valid drivers license and the ability to drive a passenger van. The physical ability to perform the essential job functions is needed. In addition, the Housing Specialist shall perform any duties as required to meet the needs of the program and the clients we serve. The agency reserves the right to review and change job duties and responsibilities as the need arises. This job description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment.

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
Job Overview

We are seeking a friendly and organized Front Desk Receptionist (STRICTLY DENTAL BCKGROUND)to join our team.

Duties

Qualified candidates must possess the following skills:  
1) Thorough knowledge of Dental PPO plans / capitation plans and electronic billing and dental coding

title: Big SNOW - Guest Experience Ambassador
description:
**Guest Experience Ambassador Big SNOW**

**Location: East Rutherford, NJ Reporting to: Guest Experience Manager**

**SNOW Partners Mission Statement:**

To Enhance the Lives of our Team, Guests and Partners by Building Lasting Connections.

**About Big SNOW:**

Big SNOW is North America's first and only real snow, indoor, year-round ski and snowboard resort. We share our passion of sliding on snow with our guests.

**How the Guest Experience Ambassador works with the Team:**

Provide guests with information that assists with an unforgettable experience at the resort.


**Team Member Responsibilities:**

* Be an accurate and reliable source of information for our Guests
* Assist with the guest retail, entry to facility, outfitting, boot fitting/rental equipment and overall positive guest experience
* Promote and educate guests on product offerings throughout the guest trail
* Perform other duties as assigned by Blazer/Guide
* Acknowledging and advocating for our guests needs as it pertains to their experience with Big SNOW
* Enforce and follow safety procedures for the team and our guests
* Scan online ticket purchases and encode media for access to rentals, tickets, etc.
* Validate entryandcards at entry points/lift base

**Team Member Qualifications:**

  

* A positive attitude and a commitment to great service.
* Ability to stand for long periods of time
* Must be 16or older
* Prior customer service, retail experience a plus
* Must be able to work a flexible schedule including weekends and holidays

title: Intimissimi Sales Ambassador PT at its Meatpacking, NYC - ICN5 location
description:
**THE ROLE**
============

Our Sales Ambassadors are the first in line to share their passion and knowledge of Intimissimi and an essential part of the brand and store team! You are responsible for sharing the story of our brand and what makes us unique!

**LIFE OF THE SALES AMBASSADOR**
================================


A Sales Ambassador is someone who genuinely enjoys talking with clients, a team player to the rest of the team and store leadership. You always demonstrate Calzedonia Groups Key Values: Open Minded, Authentic, Passionate, Dynamic, Team Player, Pragmatic!


Open Minded: Open to learning, receiving guidance and feedback from store leadership. You embrace new ideas, are receptive to customer feedback, and approach challenges with a willingness to explore innovative solutions. You understand the diverse needs and preferences of guests and colleagues, fostering an inclusive and welcoming atmosphere within the store. You actively engage with guests, adapt to ever-changing trends, ensuring a personalized shopping experience.


Authentic: Be real! Honesty is key and always working together with integrity. Sales Ambassadors embody genuineness and sincerity. You enjoy authentically connecting with guests, sharing your passion for the brand while fostering loyal and long-lasting relationships with guests and colleagues. #WeAreOne We support and encourage a respectful and inclusive team atmosphere by welcoming Diversity, Inclusion and Equity for all team members and guests.


Passionate: Share your excitement and promote brand loyalty with guests and the store team. As a Sales Ambassador you have firsthand experience with new fashion collections and can share newness with all guests. Share your passion for Intimissimi by building brand loyalty with each guest! Your goal is to ensure each guest has a


memorable experience in our shops.


Dynamic: Sales Ambassadors thrive in a fast-paced environment, embracing change and adaptability. You will be able to navigate busy hours, responding with care to guests inquiries and requests, supporting with visuals updates, assisting with stock management practices, and overall contributing to a seamless shopping experience for guests and efficient environment for colleagues.


Team Player: We are all in this together! Our Sales Ambassadors believe in teamwork through all day-to-day activities to ensure high quality experience for guests, but also supporting each other every step of the way. You collaborate effectively with colleagues, fostering a positive and cooperative atmosphere in the shop. Being part of Intimissimi means lending a helping hand to colleagues, being a mentor for new colleagues, creating a unified and motivated network that delivers high quality guest experience.


Pragmatic: You are a problem solver! You approach challenges with practicality and resourcefulness, finding effective solutions together with your colleagues and store leadership that align with the stores goals and guests needs. Always balancing creativity and efficiency, while following company policies and procedures.


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Guest Experience: Always greeting and welcoming guests with a friendly and approachable manner, providing personalized assistance and product recommendations to meet their needs.Ensure an outstanding shopping experience by providing excellent service, addressing customer feedback, and handling customer concerns professionally and efficiently.
* Product Knowledge: Develop a comprehensive understanding of Intimissimi products to confidently address guest inquiries and guide guests to finding the best products to fit their needs.
* Sales and Goals: Actively engage in selling and upselling techniques to achieve individual and store sales targets, contributing to the overall success of the store.
* Visual Merchandising: Assist in maintaining a visually appealing and organized store environment by restocking, arranging merchandise, and participating in floor moves and display changes.
* Cash Handling: Accurately handle cash transactions, credit card payments, and operate the POS (Point of Sale) system following company policies and procedures.
* Product Care: Maintain the cleanliness and presentation of products, ensuring that they are properly displayed, folded, tagged, and presented to maintain the brand's high-quality standards.
* Promotions and Events: Assist in the set-up and execution of in-store promotions, sales events, and marketing initiatives to drive traffic and boost sales.
* Stock Management: Assist with inventory management, including receiving shipments and replenishing fixtures as needed.
* Store Cleanliness: at our stores, we take great pride in providing our customers with a clean and well-maintained shopping environment. This includes the cleanliness and organization of the store: including but not limited to the salesfloor, fitting rooms, cash desk area, and backroom areas such as bathroom and stockroom. As a retail employee, you are expected to take the initiative of upkeeping the cleanliness in the store.  

Teams will be required to conduct daily cleaning tasks included but not limited to:
* Dust and clean shelves, furniture, fixtures and decor
* Clean doors, window glass, mirrors (exterior and interior)
* Pick up and empty trash cans and garbage taking it to the dumpster as needed
* Sweep and mop hard floors
* Wipe and sanitize sinks, countertops, shared common areas and equipment

**TEAM DYNAMIC**

* As a Sales Ambassador, you are the key link between guests and the store team to ensure the shop accomplishes company and brand KPIs through excellent customer service and completing store operations efficiently.
* Participate in collecting product feedback for store leadership that is shared directly to the Style Department in Italy HQ.
* Based on your experience with Intimissimi and performance, you may be selected to support New Store Openings across the US as a team bonding opportunity and a chance to put your skills and knowledge to the test!
* Participate in nationwide contests within other Intimissimi locations to show our team spirit!

**CAREER DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES**
====================================


All Sales Ambassadors get the chance to learn new skills daily. We believe in hands-on experience training in different store functions to develop an entrepreneur mindset and spirit, such as: Guest Experience, Basic Store Operations, Business Acumen, Visuals Merchandising, Stock Management, and much more!


#TeamworkMakesTheDreamWork


We are all team players! Our leaders always encourage development between team members to support professional growth.


#KnowledgeisPower


Share your knowledge and experience with new team members! We strongly believe in consistent training and development of our teams. Many of our success stories started their careers from being part of our store teams and have grown to be future Store Managers, District Managers, Sales Directors and beyond!


Be a part of the Calzedonia USA story and make your mark!

**JOB REQUIREMENTS**
====================

* Eligibility to work in the US for any Employer
* You are able to work a flexible schedule, including nights, holidays and weekends
* You are a people person! Working with a team to accomplish store goals, genuinely enjoying an environment of fun music, and building connections with our guests for the best shopping experience.
* You are able to lift in excess of 20 pounds and stand for long periods of time, bend, stretch, engage in repetitive motions, push, pull and carry items (mannequins, clothing, totes, torsos, etc.) for a short distance including climbing a ladder and use a step stool.

**COMPENSATION & BENEFITS PACKAGE**
===================================

* Base Salary (Hourly Salary) plus monthly bonus based on store volume and location.
* Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
* Company paid life and disability insurance
* Paid Time off after 1 year of service
* Sign on Bonus
* Referral bonus
* Employee Discount
* Free Uniform, and so much more!


Accelerate your skills and build a foundation for your career!

title: Direct Support Professional
description:
Position: Direct Support Professional


Program Assignment: Abilis Residential Program


Supervisor: Program Manager, Program Coordinator, or Supervising Counselor


Job Summary: As a Direct Support Professional, you will play a crucial role in the daily operations of our residential program, ensuring the well-being and development of the participants. Your responsibilities include providing care, managing household duties, overseeing health and safety, and complying with all relevant standards and procedures.


Schedule: Part-time or full-time, up to 40 hours per week. Schedules are set by the residence manager and primarily during programming hours. Overtime is based on resident needs, scheduling, and supervisor approval.


Essential Functions:

* Effectively communicate with participants.
* Summon emergency personnel when needed
* Maintain CPR and medication certifications
* Provide supervision and use adaptive equipment safely
* Implement program goals and manage behavioral issues
* Perform CPR and Heimlich maneuver if necessary
* Possess a valid drivers license and operate agency vehicles safely
* Lift up to 50 lbs.


Special Requirements:

* Demonstrate empathy and maturity in working with diverse individuals with disabilities
* Assist Supervising Counselor in direct care and goal implementation
* Complete required state training programs


General Responsibilities:

* Ensure residents' well-being by facilitating a supportive environment for personal growth. Assist in daily living skills, program implementation, and documentation.
* Perform tasks like grocery shopping, meal planning, light home repairs, and coordinating with co-workers.
* Monitor residents' health, manage medical appointments, and ensure proper medication use.
* Adhere to licensing standards and maintain necessary documentation.
* Provide clear information to residents and collaborate with staff, families, and external services.
* Promote positive interactions within the community.
* Complete required training and participate in development programs for licensure.


Qualifications:

* High school diploma or GED. One year of human service work experience may substitute for education.
* Preferably one year in rehabilitation, educational, or residential programs.

title: Bakery Associate
description:
***We are looking for a Bakery Associate to join our family-owned Italian grocery and assist the Bakery Department in making delicious and irresistible baked goods and treats.***

**We offer:** Competitive pay Medical Insurance Health Reimbursement Account Dental Insurance Vision Insurance A variety of income protection insurance programs (Disability, Term Life, Critical Illness, Accident), Paid Time Off 401k with Employer Match Generous Employee Discount *(Benefits vary depending on hours regularly scheduled to work.)*


The Bakery Associate contributes to the companys operation and success by assisting customers and maintaining a neat and visually appealing bakery department with a wide variety of freshly baked items. Attributes that contribute to success in this role include strong interpersonal skills, being able to excel in a fast-paced work environment, and the ability to multitask.


**The Bakery Associates duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

* Providing high quality customer service by engaging customers and responding to questions.
* Assisting in the mixing and preparing of baked goods, including the decorating of cakes, cookies, pies, and other desserts, and the procuring of ingredients for baked goods.
* Assisting customers with special orders, with extra attention given to specific requests.
* Assisting with the preparation of party platters, trays and pre-packaged goods.
* Weighing, preparing, packaging, and labeling goods in a precise and sanitary manner consistent with department guidelines.
* Setting up displays and ensuring prices and promotions are easily visible.
* Maintaining a sanitary and tidy work area, including cleaning cases, shelves, and aisles, sweeping and mopping floors, and ensuring proper safety signage.
* Complying with sanitation and hygienic standards and regulations.

**The Bakery Associates work hours vary and will consist of day and evening shifts.**

**The ideal candidate for the Bakery Associate position:**

* Has a minimum of 3 months previous experience in a retail grocery store or bakery.
* Can interact cordially with customers, including educating customers and offering suggestions.
* Can operate a cash register and possesses basic math skills.
* Is punctual, reliable, and can adhere to a regularly assigned work schedule.
* Can work expeditiously and efficiently.
* Excels in a team environment.
* Can lift up to 50lbs.

title: Center Director - Manhasset
description:
**Job Title:** Early Childhood Center Director

**Location:** Manhasset

**Employment Type:** Full-time

**Reports To:** Executive Director

**Job Summary:**


We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Early Childhood Center Director to lead our early childhood education center. The ideal candidate will be passionate about early childhood education, possess strong leadership skills, and have a proven track record of managing a successful early childhood program.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Program Management:** Oversee the daily operations of the center, ensuring a safe, nurturing, and engaging environment for children.
* **Staff Leadership:** Recruit, hire, train, and supervise teaching and administrative staff. Provide ongoing professional development and conduct regular performance evaluations.
* **Curriculum Development:** Implement and oversee a developmentally appropriate curriculum that meets state standards and fosters the social, emotional, and cognitive growth of all children.
* **Compliance:** Ensure that the center complies with all local, state, and federal regulations, including licensing requirements and health and safety standards.
* **Family Engagement:** Build and maintain strong relationships with families, ensuring clear communication and collaboration. Address any concerns or issues promptly and effectively.
* **Financial Management:** Develop and manage the center's budget, including tuition collection, payroll, and expense monitoring. Identify opportunities for financial growth and sustainability.
* **Community Outreach:** Represent the center in the community, building partnerships with local organizations, schools, and agencies to enhance program offerings and support services.
* **Quality Assurance:** Regularly assess program quality and implement improvements to ensure excellence in early childhood education.

**Benefits:**

* Health, dental, and vision insurance.
* Paid time off (PTO) and holidays.
* Professional development opportunities.
* Retirement plan options.
* **Education:** Bachelors degree in Early Childhood Education, Child Development, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
* **Experience:** Minimum of 5 years of experience in early childhood education, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.
* **Licensing:** Must meet all state requirements for a Child Care Director, including any required certifications.
* **Skills:** Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills. Ability to work collaboratively with staff, families, and the community.
* **Knowledge:** Deep understanding of early childhood development, curriculum planning, and state licensing requirements.
* **Certifications:** CPR and First Aid certification (or willingness to obtain).

title: Substitute Teacher - New Hyde Park
description:

----------------------

-


Under the supervision of the Head Teacher and Center Director, the Assistant Teacher will be responsible for working within the framework of Harbor Child Care carrying out its functions, educational philosophy, policies and procedures including but not limited to:

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**:


The Assistant Teacher, under the supervision of the Head Teacher and Associate Teacher, is responsible for the planning and execution of a classroom program that takes into account the educational, social development and health needs of the group as well as the individual child. The Asst. Teacher is required to lift and carry children as well as be physically fit to actively participate in age appropriate activities for the class

**Duties and Responsibilities**

* Assists in developing a program of developmentally appropriate practices
* Upholds Harbors philosophy and policies, i.e. health & safety, nutrition and regulations as stated in the Parent Policy, New Employee Welcome Manual and Employee Handbook.
* Actively implements age appropriate The Creative Curriculum.
* Supports children during transition time.
* Responsible for supervision of children
* Supports and actively participates in an active work and outdoor time.
* Works with Head Teacher and Director concerning children with special needs.

**Record keeping**

**Reports**

* Write six week and twice yearly cumulative reports.

**Parent Relations**

* Fosters positive parent relationships through respecting the confidential nature of all information about parents and children.
* Uses Contact Notes for staff and parent concerns.

**Self-Evaluation**

* Assumes responsibility for discussing his/her professional performance objectively at regularly scheduled supervisor conferences with the Assistant Director or Director using these conferences as a source of information and professional guidance.

title: School RN| Full-Time - New Hyde Park
description:
**Job Title:** Early Childhood School Registered Nurse (RN)

**Location:** New Hyde Park

**Employment Type:** Full-time

**Hourly Rate:** $40/hr

**Reports To:** Center Director and Health Services Coordinator

**Job Summary:**


Harbor Child Care is seeking a compassionate and dedicated Registered Nurse (RN) to join our early childhood education team. The RN will play a crucial role in ensuring the health and well-being of our students, providing direct care, health education, and supporting a safe learning environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Health Assessments:** As needed.
* **First Aid and Emergency Care:** Provide first aid and emergency care to students and staff as needed. Manage and administer medications in accordance with medical orders and school policies.
* **Health Plans:** Develop and implement individualized health care plans for students with chronic conditions or special needs. Work closely with parents, teachers, and administrators to ensure proper care and accommodations.
* **Disease Prevention:** Monitor and manage communicable diseases, following public health guidelines for prevention and reporting. Conduct screenings (e.g., vision, hearing) as required.
* **Record Keeping:** Maintain accurate and confidential health records for all students, including immunizations, health assessments, and incident reports.
* **Collaboration:** Work collaboratively with teachers, administrators, and other school staff to support students' overall health and well-being. Serve as a liaison between the school, families, and healthcare providers.
* **Compliance:** Ensure compliance with all state and local regulations regarding school health services. Stay updated on best practices and emerging health concerns.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.
* Health, dental, and vision insurance.
* Paid time off (PTO) and holidays.
* Professional development opportunities.
* Retirement plan options.
* **Licensure:** Current Registered Nurse (RN) license in the state of New York.
* **Experience:** Minimum of 2 years of nursing experience, preferably in pediatrics or school nursing.
* **Education:** Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Nursing from an accredited program.
* **Certifications:** CPR and First Aid certification required. Additional certifications in pediatric care or school nursing are a plus.
* **Skills:** Strong clinical assessment skills, excellent communication and organizational abilities, and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* **Knowledge:** Understanding of child development, common pediatric health concerns, and public health guidelines.
* **Availability:** Flexible availability between 7am and 6pm.

### **Job Summary:**


Harbor Child Care is seeking a dedicated and experienced Program Director to lead our UPK (Universal Pre-K) and Pre-K programs. title: House Cleaner
description:

* ***Go-Getter:*** You have a hard time sitting at a desk all day because you like to move and stay busy? You Follow Directions and have a keen Eye for Detail - you notice little things that others miss!

* ***Multi-tasker:*** You can rub your belly & pat your head at the same time. When given big projects with many small pieces, you say "BRING IT ON!"

title: Oncology Social Worker
description:
**Oncology Social Worker Full Time**

**New York or Regional New Jersey**


This is a hybrid position and will require both in-office (3 days) and remote work (2 days).

**Salary - $65,344.00 - $66,344.00**


Cancer*Care* is the leading national organization dedicated to providing free, professional support services, including resource navigation, individual counseling, support groups, educational workshops, publications, and financial assistance to anyone affected by cancer.


Cancer*Care* seeks a full-time Oncology Social Worker to deliver its free services to people whose lives are affected by cancer.


Cancer*Care* has three office locations:

* National Office is located at 275 Seventh Ave, New York, NY 10001
* New Jersey Regional Office is located at 1 Kalisa Way, Paramus, NJ 07652
* Long Island Regional Office is located at 819 Grand Blvd, Deer Park, NY 11729


The position is full-time, Monday through Friday, two days from 11 AM to 7 PM and three days from 9 AM to 5 PM.


The Oncology Social Worker will be responsible for:

* Providing immediate assistance and support to cancer patients, caregivers, and/or those who are bereaved by contacting Cancer*Care* via a national toll-free Hopeline;
* Providing individual counseling (in-person, via Zoom and/or telephone), as well as support groups (in-person, via Zoom, telephone, and/or message board);
* Providing resource navigation via telephone to people with cancer and;
* Addressing client needs by conducting timely and effective psychosocial assessments and evaluations as needed;
* Utilizes knowledge of community resources to refer clients to appropriate services to ensure continuity and quality of care;
* Documents all social work activities in a timely manner according to departmental protocols;
* Participating in local presentations, workshops, health fairs, fundraising, walks, and community events (in-person and via Zoom);
* Upholding the Cancer*Care* brand and philosophy.
* Bilingual Spanish is Strongly Preferred
* Qualified applicants must have a Masters Degree in Social Work and a Licensed Master of Social Work credential in New York or New Jersey is REQUIRED
* A background in health, hospice, or mental health settings delivering intervention to clients coping with chronic and acute life-threatening illness as well as with the bereaved is required. Knowledge of medical and psychosocial aspects of cancer is preferred
* A willingness to work with clients who are experiencing stress and trauma in their lives as a result of coping with chronic and life-threatening illnesses
* Excellent communication (both oral and written), highly organized with strong analytical, problem-solving and interpersonal skills, with the ability to write quickly, clearly and compellingly
* Proficiency in computer skills and Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, Zoom), as well as the ability to utilize multiple programs simultaneously

 **Please provide a cover letter with your resume.**


This job posting provides a general list of the essential responsibilities and qualifications required for this position. It does not represent a contract for employment, and Cancer*Care*reserves the right to change the description and/or posting at any time without notice.


Cancer*Care*provides an attractive benefits package that includes health insurance, a retirement plan, paid time off, standard holidays, and commuter benefits.


Cancer*Care*is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, genetic information, veteran/military status, or any other protected characteristic as established under law. We are dedicated to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for our staff and clients.

title: Social Media Specialist
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE & THE COMPANY:

TThe New York fashion industry is synonymous with the speed of the city itself. New York is famously known as the city that never sleeps, and its fashion industry is not exception. Hence, our extremely fast-paced work environment, that is constantly evolving, as our operation runs 24/7. Our team is a close-knit group with a bond strengthened from constant team-building activities.

ABOUT THE BRAND:

The Tailory New York is a rapidly-growing, innovative company that fuses modern fashion design with classic custom tailoring. We are the only custom clothing company that caters to men, women, and non-binary individuals in equal measure. Our concept is simple; we believe that everyone’s wardrobe should not only fit perfectly but also be designed with only the individual client in mind. The end result? Clients get the best of both worlds: impeccable fit and custom-designed pieces that work seamlessly with their lifestyle.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Contribute to omnichannel optimization.
* Assist with the evolution of our e-commerce platform.
* Facilitate tasks delegated like product advertising and placement.
* All team members journey to and from the Garment District, and handle deliveries.
* Comfortable visiting and communicating with businesses in the garment district.
* Assist with daily activities and tasks.
* Design and execute marketing content for email campaigns, social media advertisements and promotions, and other platforms that meet The Tailory New York’s branding objectives.
* Assist in planning and executing events, fashion shows, and photoshoots.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* Keen awareness of client experience and anticipation to client needs.
* Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Strong computer skills, specifically Excel, Photoshop, and Illustrator software.
* Highly organized, motivated, and a team player.
* Entrepreneurial spirit and ability to wear multiple hats.
* Willingness to go the extra mile.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to $35,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Day shift

Application Question(s):

* Do you want to tell us anything else about you that you did not convey in your cover letter?
* Please describe what interests you have in the fashion business, as well as who and what in fashion inspire you.
* After reading the description of this internship, what expectations do you have for this role?
* Based on a scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the best. Please rate your problem-solving skills, including troubleshooting software applications, and explain your self-rating.
* Based on a scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the best. Please rate your assertiveness, and explain your self-rating.
* Describe your work ethic, and provide examples of any life experience(s) that you have had that personify the type of colleague that you are.
* This is an in-person only role. Will you be able to reliably commute to New York, NY 10013 for this job?

title: Business Development Admin
description:
Join the exciting Trinity Solar! Become part of a winning team with more than 25 years of experience in business and countless awards!


Trinity Solar provides exceptional service and top-notch solutions for our valued customers. We are currently seeking a motivated and an enthusiastic Executive Assistant to join our team and play a key role in our continued success. This is the chance you have been looking for to ignite your career in an environment that will support your success!


We are looking for an admin who is team-oriented and a great communicator. The ideal candidate is someone who loves taking on new challenges and has experience supporting a team of managers. If you are looking for an exciting opportunity to expand your talents, this is your chance! In this critical position you will provide support and assistance to high level managers and executives. If you work well under pressure, are great at multitasking, and can think on your toes, we want you to be part of our outstanding team!

**Responsibilities:**


Provide administrative support to leadership team of Lead Generation


Management of administrative duties for our Community Stewardship, Purchased leads, and Field Marketing


Calendar management of Community Stewardship, Purchased Leads, and Field Marketing events


Meeting minutes for any Community Stewardship, Purchased Leads, and Field Marketing meetings


Keep updated records for Field Marketing Milestone Project


Manage the photo procurement process and creation of the Field Marketing Milestone Project files


Organization of proposals for all Field Marketing incentives and travel


Organization of proposals for all Communities Stewardship and Field Marketing events


Create and edit presentations as needed


Assist in processing Lead audits on case-by-case basis

**Requirements:**


Position is can be in-person, remote, or hybrid


At least 3 years of experience supporting a team in an administrative capacity


Extremely professional with a customer-oriented mindset


Must be self-driven & highly motivated


Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite is required (Word, Excel, PPT, Access, Outlook)


Excellent communicator, high attention to detail, and very organized


Must have great time management skills and the ability to prioritize


Work extremely well under pressure and thrive working in a fast-paced environment


Proven track record setting and achieving goals


Experience using Salesforce is a plus

**What We Offer:**


Competitive pay Base Salary $55,000/yr


Comprehensive Paid training included (typically 4-5 days)


Supportive and collaborative work environment


Opportunities for career advancement within our company


Amazing benefits:

* 401(k) available with match
* Benefits package including available medical, dental, vision and life insurances

**ABOUT OUR COMPANY**


Trinity Solar Inc. has been recognized two times as the largest privately held residential solar installation contractor in the United States. Awarded as INCs top 5,000 fastest growing companies, you will be entering into a dynamic organization focused on changing how the world uses energy. Founded over 25 years ago, Trinity Solar Inc. built their company based on employee first mentality and values that have developed a culture and business into what over 3.,200 proud workers call home.

*Trinity Solar Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Consistent with that goal, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.*

title: Roofing Jr. Project Manager
description:
Trinity Solar, the Northeast largest privately-owned solar integrator, is seeking a Junior Roofing Project Manager to join our growing roofing team. The Junior Project Manager will be responsible for working alongside the Senior Project Manager to plan and execute projects, monitor various platforms and communicate with team members on status changes.

**Roles & Responsibilities:**

* Coordinate and manage roofing projects from inception to completion, ensuring all tasks are completed on time and meet company standards.
* Customer communication for updates throughout the process, including the day before, the day of, and after completion of the project.
* Define the projects scope of work and identify potential obstructions to prepare for deliveries and installations. Provide detailed project instructions to installation partners, distribution partners, customers, and other Trinity team members as necessary.
* Track and record roof permit applications on Trinity platforms, keeping team members informed of any status changes.
* Continuously monitor multiple projects at various stages of the roof installation process. Keep project documents updated, upload files, and input information into platforms.
* Review end-of-project photos and documents to ensure accuracy and quality standards.
* Review and communicate accounting requirements with the client for outstanding payments.
* Serve as a liaison to assist in troubleshooting issues related to roof repair requests, ensuring timely and effective resolution.
* Implementation of evolving processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness in project coordination and company operations.

**Qualifications & Experience:**

* Strong organizational and problem-solving skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Experience in the roofing industry or related field is preferred.
* Familiar with permit application processes and municipal requirements.
* Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities. Ability to work collaboratively with various teams and stakeholders.
* Commitment to delivering exceptional customer service and maintaining high standards of quality.
* Must be advanced/proficient in Microsoft Office 365
* Excel and PowerPoint experience
* Flexibility with occasionally working a few weekend and evening hours
* Designated remote workspace with reliable internet access**.**
* Ability to travel to the corporate office as needed.

**What We Offer**

*Not just a career... but a career path to success!* Trinity Solar offers you a career in one of the fastest growing fields in the country. A career with Trinity Solar is a path to personal and professional growth with a company who truly values its employees. Our employees enjoy...

* Competitive compensation
* Comprehensive healthcare benefits which include:
* Medical, Dental and Vision
* Life insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Paid training
* A generous PTO program
* 401k plan supported by a company match
* Work-life balance
* Long term stability in a fast-growing industry
* The satisfaction of knowing they are working for an organization leading the way in clean energy initiatives
* And Much MORE!

**About Us**


Since 1994, Trinity Solar has proudly provided energy with integrity to families in our area. Trinity started in the solar industry with two core fundamental principles, to make renewable energy accessible and to make the solar journey seamless. These guiding beliefs have led Trinity Solar to become the United States largest privately held residential solar installer, composed of more than 3,000 team members, and boasting over 100,000 installations. Currently, Trinity offers solar installation in Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, New Jersey, New Hampshire, New York, Massachusetts, Maryland, Pennsylvania, and Rhode Island.

*Trinity Solar is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Consistent with that goal, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.*

*"Veteran Friendly"*

title: Administrative Coordinator - Staten Island Treatment Alternatives for Safer Communities (TASC)
description:
Administrative Coordinator


EAC Network, a not-for-profit social service agency that empowers, assists, and cares for over 62,888 people in need through 100 programs across Long Island and NYC, seeks an Administrative Coordinator to work full time for its Staten Island Treatment Alternatives for Safer Communities (TASC) Program. The Administrative Coordinator will be the first point of contact for clients seeking services with in the Staten Island TASC program.


The Administrative Coordinator position is anon-exempt position paying $20 per hour at 35 hours per week. The hours of operation are Monday-Friday 9:00AM-5:00PM and the office is located in Staten Island, NY. The role reports to the Program Director.

**Comprehensive benefits package includes:**


Medical


Dental


401K


Vision


Very generous Paid Time Off (PTO) & More.

**Primary Purpose of Job:**


The Administrative Coordinator is responsible for assisting the Program Director in coordinating program operations for the Staten Island TASC program.

**Principal Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Assist Director and Supervisors in coordinating daily operations of the program and supervise office operations in their absence.
* Answer, screen and direct phone calls and perform receptionist function at program office.
* Handle petty cash and metro card disbursements and reconciliation.
* Perform typing and general office duties.
* Collect, review and input client admissions, rejections and pending cases into databases and assist Program Director and Supervisors in compiling monthly reports.
* Oversee office supplies, maintain inventory and perform administrative duties as needed.
* Oversee client intake schedule.
* Oversee on and offsite storage files.
* Assist the Case Management Unit with all aspects of case coordination and preparation for DOHMH monthly audit and maintain Audit Log.

**Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Required:**

* High School Diploma or educational equivalent required, college degree preferred.
* Minimum of one year of work experience in either human services or alcohol/substance abuse programs required.
* Must have a pleasant phone manner, good communication skills, both oral and written as well as the ability to work cooperatively with treatment providers and court personnel.
* Must be proficient in computer applications or other automated systems such as spreadsheets, Microsoft Office applications, calendar, email and/or database software necessary to perform work assignments.
* Minimum of two years of relevant office experience including general office, typing, data entry, and computer skills required.
* **Bilingual (English/Spanish Speaking a Plus!)**

title: Case Manager - Suffolk Transitional Case Management
description:
Case Manager


EAC Network, a not-for-profit social service agency that empowers, assists, and cares for over 62,888 people in need through 100 programs across Long Island and NYC, seeks a Case Manager to work full time for its Suffolk Transitional Case Management Program.


The Case Manager position is a non-exempt position paying $28 per hour at 35 hours per week. Work schedule includes 2-3 days in the Riverhead or Yaphank Correctional facilities from 7:30AM-3:30PM. Remaining days will be in the office from 9:00AM-5:00PM. The office is located in Central Islip, NY. The role reports to the Program Director.

**Comprehensive benefits package includes:**

* Medical
* Dental
* 401K
* Vision
* Very generous Paid Time Off (PTO) & More.

**Primary Purpose of Job:**


The Case Manager for the Suffolk Transitional Case Management (TCM) Program is responsible for providing enhanced transition planning and care management services to persons being released from local correctional facilities and New York State prisons who are returning to Suffolk County. The Case Manager will work within the Suffolk County Correctional facilities located in Riverhead and Yaphank.

**Principal Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Provide Services to a target population of incarcerated Suffolk County residents, eighteen (18) years of age and older with a documented psychiatric illness. Services shall be provided both pending and post release to persons being released from local correctional facilities and New York State prisons who are returning to Suffolk County.
* Meet with Suffolk County Correctional Facilitys Jail Behavioral Health Unit staff to identify and accept clients who could benefit from TCM services.
* Develop integrated reentry service plans and provide a copy of service plans with linkages to post-release services to the Jail Mental Health Unit.
* Assist individuals being released from incarceration in applying for and obtaining all necessary benefits and entitlements; and facilitate the connection of individuals to appropriate aftercare services, housing, vocational/educational services, and related peer support networks in order to reduce the risk of psychiatric relapse leading to re-incarceration or hospitalization.
* Work closely with the Suffolk County Department of Social Services to ensure timely activation of Medicaid and other benefits.
* Enroll and dis-enroll persons to/from the Medication Grant Program.
* Receive information from the Divisions Assisted Outpatient Treatmentunit regarding inmates with active AOT court orders, respond to requests for follow-up services and provide reports as required.
* Ensure timely linkages to community care management including Health Home Care Management.
* Refer inmates whose Medicaid status is uncertain to the Divisions adult SPOA Unit for linkage to non-Medicaid funded care management.
* Maintain complete client records and have available for inspection by Supervision at any time.
* Conduct toxicology testing to monitor recovery if needed.
* Maintain caseload through ongoing client contact.
* Transport and escort clients to/from appointments when needed.
* Attend meetings and clinical trainings.

**Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities Required:**

* Bachelors Degree in Social Work, Mental Health Counseling or Criminal Justice with at least two years of experience working with the mentally ill criminal justice involved population.
* Knowledge of available treatment services and ability to work cooperatively with housing, treatment and mental health systems.
* Must have valid NYS (New York State) Drivers License and be willing to transport clients to appointments using own vehicle. Must provide proof of valid NYS car insurance and Defensive Driving Certificate within 30 days of hire. Valid registration, inspection and Automobile Insurance Liability of a recommended minimum of 100,000/300,000 will also be evaluated upon hire.
* Good communication skills, both oral and written.
* Must be proficient in computer applications or other automated systems such as spreadsheets, Microsoft Office applications, calendar, and email and/or database software necessary to perform work assignments.

title: Warehouse Administrative Assistant- NJ
description:
**The starting pay rate is $18.00/hr., with a $0.50 shift differential bringing it to $18.50/hr.**

**Role Summary:**


The Warehouse Administrative Assistantis a focal point between multiple departments in a global company and requires a high-energy, detail-oriented professional to effectively communicate and help meet project requirements.

**What we offer:**

* Monday to Friday 3:30 PM to 11:00 PM
* Matching 401k Plan
* Annual Performance Review
* QuarterlyBonus
* Employee Sponsored Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, FSA) after 30 days.
* Paid time off after 30 days
* Employee discount on company product
* Summer and Holiday festivities

**Key Responsibilities (or Principal Accountabilities):**

* Sign-in drivers when they come for pick up and process inbound/outbound orders in SAP.
* Ensure that phone calls are answered promptly and rerouted as appropriate.
* Perform data entry into SAP, Excel/ Microsoft.
* Provide administrative support to the Warehouse Manager & Warehouse Lead.
* Coordinate special projects, as necessary.
* Check if picklists are confirmed properly.
* Print pallet labels.
* Processreturns in the system (SAP).
* Processmonthly re-work orders.

**Minimum Requirements:**

* Our ideal candidate will be a fast learner, able to follow instructions, and is reliable and accountable.
* Basic Microsoft Office suite, including Excel
* Organized and detail-oriented
* Previous admin assistant experience required, preferably in awarehouse setting
* Heavy data entry experience a must- Able to work in a fast past environment.

**Desired Qualifications:**

* Preferred experience in SAP
* Previous Food Manufacturing experience a plus
* Bilingual (English, Spanish) helpful

**Physical Demands:**

* Sedentary work. Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/ or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects.
* Repetitive motion. Substantial movements (motions) of the wrists, hands, and/ or fingers.
* Ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and to make the discriminations in sounds.
* Those activities in which they must convey detailed or important spoken instructions to other workers accurately, loudly, or quickly.

**Work Environment:**

* Ideal candidate will be placed in a workstation inside the warehouse.


LT Foods Americas (LTFA) is part of LT Foods Limited, an emerging global food company, with Net Sales in excess of $600 million globally, operating across a range of categories including specialty rice, organic foods and convenience rice-based products. The Company is engaged in milling, processing and marketing of branded and non-branded basmati rice, and manufacturing of rice food products in India & international market. LT Foods has a global presence including India, Middle East, United Kingdom, Europe, and United States. Its operations include contract farming, procurement, storage, processing, packaging, and distribution. Its rice product portfolio comprises brown, white, steamed, parboiled, organic, quick-cooking brown rice, and ready-to-heat rice. The Company's brands include DAAWAT, ROYAL; 817 ELEPHANT, INDUS VALLEY, ECOLIFE & GRAPEOLA.
company_description: Today, LT Foods is one of the few global companies that oversees the harvesting, milling, processing and distribution of our foods.

title: NJ Forklift Operator
description:
**Starting Pay rate is $18/hr. with a $0.50 shift differential and quarterly bonuses!**

**LT Foods Americasis growing - join our team now!We are located in Dayton, NJ.**

**Were looking for hardworking, ambitious, and motivated Forklift Drivers to support our Manufacturing Operation. We need people who have excellent attendance, attention to detail, and a positive attitude!**

**We offer competitive pay, benefits, vacation time, and more!**

**What we offer:**

* Monday- Friday (must be flexible to work overtime)
* 2nd shift -3:30PM to 11:00PM ($0.50 shift differential for 2nd shift bringing you to $18.50)
* Employee Sponsored Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, life, FSA) after 30 days.
* Annual Performance Reviews
* Paid time off after 30 days (up to 26 days off annually!)
* Employee discount on company product
* Quarterly bonus
* Monthly Company sponsoredlunches

**Key Responsibilities (or Principle Accountabilities):**


Load and unload containers using various forklifts * -sit down, reach, pallet jack, and hand trucks. Operate dock levelers. May use slip sheets and push-pull attachments.
* Stage and organize all incoming and outgoing products.
* Pull and prepare products for shipment in an efficient manner to meet customer standards.
* Stack skids or pallets in designated areas; clean up and dispose of scraps, cardboard, plastic wrap, and trash.
* Maintain the facilitys equipment and materials in a safe, clean, and orderly fashion and comply with all safety rules and procedures.
* Use the handheld scanner to input product information accurately into SAP system, label all products, and put away products in designated areas.
* Effectively follow shipping and receiving procedures.
* Assist to conduct periodic inventory counts.
* Perform work safely, and efficiently and meet established deadlines.
* Performed other functions and tasks as assigned.

**Minimum Requirements:**

* Must have at least 2 years of recent Forklift experience
* Basic math skills to count product.
* Ability to work occasional overtime and weekends, as needed.

**Desired Qualifications:**

* Food experience is always desired but not required.
* Slip sheet experience a plus.

**Physical Demands:**

* Prolonged sitting.
* Hand dexterity and strength.
* Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.

**Work Environment:**


This position works in a fast-paced plant manufacturing/warehouse setting. Exposed to moving machinery such as forklifts and production equipment. Exposed to loud noise from moving forklifts and production equipment. Exposed to extreme temperatures and dust. Must wear all required PPE, to include safety hat, safety glasses, steel toe shoes, face covering and ear plugs.
company_description: Today, LT Foods is one of the few global companies that oversees the harvesting, milling, processing and distribution of our foods.

title: Crew
description:
**Is it you?**  

Our Crew Members create a warm and friendly shopping experience in our stores. We answer questions, offer suggestions, and ensure our customers know they are welcomed and cared for. We entertain customers and make grocery shopping an exciting adventure.


Some responsibilities may include:

* Working on teams to accomplish goals
* Operating the cash register in a fun and efficient manner
* Bagging groceries with care
* Stocking shelves
* Creating signage to inform and delight customers
* Helping customers find their favorite products


You'll learn a lot. You're not stuck doing one task here. Each Crew Member contributes to creating a WOW customer experience by participating in all aspects of the job.


If you have experience in art including penmanship, working with chalk, and large signage, that's a plus.


If you have a passion for people and a fervor for food, we'd love to meet you. We can teach you the rest.


Stores have the greatest need for people that can work evenings and weekends.


Trader Joe's is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to hiring a diverse Crew.
company_description: When it comes to grocery chains, Trader Joe's isn't your average Joe.

title: Sales Associate
description:
**Join the Pacsun Community**  

  

Pacsun is dedicated to delivering an exclusive collection of the most relevant brands and styles to a community of inspired youth. Through partnerships with brands such as adidas, Brandy Melville, Essentials Fear of God, our own brands, and many more.



Our Pacsun community believes in and understands the importance of using our voice, platform, and resources to inspire and bring about positive development. Our program PacCares supports and partners with organizations that align with our internal and external initiatives surrounding mental health, diversity, and equality. Join the Pacsun Community.



Learn more here: LinkedIn- Our Community


**About the Job:**



The Sales Associate is responsible for generating sales through exhibiting passion for product, brands, fashion and trends with all customers. The Sales Associate is also responsible for executing initiatives and tasks as assigned by the leadership team. Overall, the Sales Associate is expected to work as a positive member of the store team and consistently provide an exceptional customer experience.


**A day in the life, what you’ll be doing:**



CUSTOMER CENTRIC


* Delivers an engaging, positive and authentic customer experience with all customers
* Focuses on full-price selling while maintaining awareness of product value and promotions
* Handles customer situations in compliance with policy and procedures, attempts to "solve for yes" and partners with the leadership when dealing with escalated issues
* Completes all assigned tasks in a timely and efficient manner
* Executes all visual directives and maintains visual standards set by the company and as directed by the management team
* Supports high standards of organization and cleanliness, promoting safe working and shopping environment to maximize the customer experience
* Upholds and complies with all company policies as outlined in the Policy and Procedure Manual, Code of Business Conduct, Employee Policy Guide and the Safety Program
* Complies with all Loss Prevention policies, and communicates violations directly to the leadership team or via the Silent Witness Hotline
* Shares feedback from customers with the leadership team to improve the overall customer experience


RESULT DRIVEN


* Actively participates in all company and store contests and events
* Stays current on all financial goals and priorities
* Support the leadership team in achieving all sales and operational goals
* Supports and executes all digital sales strategies including ship from store and BOPIS within the store


AUTHENTICITY


* Reflects the PacSun brand by demonstrating passion and affinity for product, brands, fashion and trends
* Contributes to positive working environment by consistently exhibiting core value behaviors
* Maintains and drives the company's fashion image by adhering to the Employee Appearance Guidelines
* Demonstrates willingness, aptitude, and initiative to learn what is unknown about product, brands, fashion and trends
* Strives to improve individual performance while working as a productive member of the team

  


**What it takes to Join:**

* Passion for product, brands, fashion and trends
* High School Diploma or equivalent preferred
* Effective written, verbal and presentation skills
* Strong communications skills
* Excellent time management skills
* Proficient in math and possesses strong computer skills


 P**ac Perks:**



 $1,000 referral incentive program


* Generous associate discount of 30-50% off merchandise online and in-stores
* Immediate 100% vested 401K contributions and employer match
* Calm Premium access for all employees
* Employee perks throughout the year


**Physical Requirements:**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that are required by an associate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.


* The associate must frequently lift and/or move up to 20 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 35 pounds.
* The associate must frequently sit/stand for long periods of time and climb ladders as needed.
* While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to talk or hear. The associate is frequently required to sit; stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; as well as reach, twist or squat.
* Ability to maneuver around sales floor, stockroom and office areas.
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
* Ability to work in open environment with fluctuating temperatures and standard lighting.
* Hotel, Airplane, and Car Travel may be required SM and above roles only.


**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work:**

This is a part-time position. Ability to work a range between 20-40 hours per week is required. As a National Retailer, flexibility with work schedule (able to work weekends, nights, peak holiday periods) is required.


**Other Considerations:**

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the associate for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Reasonable accommodations may be made to qualified individuals with disabilities to enable them to perform the essential functions of the role.
company_description: PacSun is dedicated to delivering an exclusive collection of the most relevant brands and styles to a community of inspired youth. Curated in Los Angeles.

title: Registered Nurse, Ambulatory
description:
Cardiology experience preferred


  
Cardiology experience preferred


  
Atlantic Medical Group is a physician-led and physician-governed organization that delivers the highest quality health care, at the right place, the right price, and the right time. We are a multispecialty physician group with more than 1,000 doctors, nurse practitioners and physician assistants at over 300 locations throughout northern and central New Jersey and northeast Pennsylvania. Our mission is to deliver exceptional care recognizing the unique needs of all those we serve. Our vision is to achieve the best outcomes with our patients at the center of the physician-led team, driven by service, innovation and continuous learning.


Our integrated network offers seamless access to Atlantic Health System’s entire health care continuum and our nationally and regionally ranked hospitals. In collaboration with Atlantic Health System, several of our practices offer urgent care and walk-in services.


In addition to primary care physicians, the team includes specialists that care for patients in all aspects of their health from pediatrics to geriatrics and everything in between. We make health decisions easier for patients with enhanced access to referrals.

title: Food Services Representative I - Part Time
description:
Responsible for performing a wide range of duties involved with preparing and/or serving foods and beverages in one or more of a variety of food service environments. Prepares salad items, hot foods, and/or cold foods, and/or assists in the preparing bakery items. Serves hospital patients, or other patrons of dining area, and performs a variety of duties on the tray line. Also participates in feed services in admitted patient departments.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

1. Works in a retail and patient services environment
  

2. Assembles and delivers meal trays for patients, restocks items on workstations, collects soiled dishes, scraps trays and washes, sanitizes and restocks flatware and silverware.
  

3. Interacts with patients in taking meal orders and delivering meal trays.
  

4. Monitors patient and retail food lines and test trays for quality, temperature and food safety.
  

5. Informs department leadership of any safety issues on units, cafeteria or in kitchen.
  

6. Restocks products for patient use on the tray line.
  

7. Removes trash from kitchen.
  

8. Maintains the high standards of AHS in creating appealing presentation and food preparation.
  

9. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. High School Diploma or equivalent.
  

2. 1 year of experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified.
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. At least one (1) year of food service or retail customer service experience preferred.


  
ABOUT US


At Atlantic Health System, our promise to our communities is; Anyone who enters one of our facilities, will receive the highest quality care delivered at the right time, at the right place, and at the right cost. This commitment is also echoed in the respect, development and opportunities we give to our more than 20,000 team members. Headquartered in Morristown, New Jersey, we are one of the leading non-profit health care systems in the nation. Our facilities and sites of care include:


* Morristown Medical Center, Morristown, NJ
* Overlook Medical Center, Summit, NJ

We also have more than 900 community-based healthcare providers affiliated through Atlantic Medical Group. Atlantic Accountable Care Organization is one of the largest ACOs in the nation, and we are a member of AllSpire Health Partners.

We are the only hospital in New Jersey named one of America's '50 Best Hospitals' for six consecutive years by Healthgrades and one of the World's Best Hospitals by Newsweek. We were included on Becker's Healthcare 2020 list of "100 Great Hospitals in America". In addition, Leapfrog recognized us with an "A" hospital safety grade - its highest - twelve consecutive times, and the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services awarded us again with its highest five-start rating in 2020.

title: Nurse Practitioner, Hospital Medicine, Newton Medical Center
description:
**Atlantic Health System is Seeking a Nurse Practitioner for Hospital Medicine at Newton Medical Center**

Newton Medical Center, part of the Atlantic Health System, is seeking a compassionate and skilled Nurse Practitioner to join the Hospital Medicine Team. In this pivotal role, the primary focus will be supporting ER admissions, contributing to the mission of delivering exceptional patient care. This position also requires patient rounding and flexibility, as needed. The position offers significant opportunities for career growth, with hands-on experiences in a collaborative and multidisciplinary environment. The ideal candidate will have clinical expertise, strong communication skills, and a positive, caring attitude.  



**Benefits**

* Competitive salary
* Robust benefits with health, dental, Rx and vision plans
* 403b retirement plan with company match
* Comprehensive Malpractice Policy
* Non-Profit Health System – eligible for Federal Student Loan Forgiveness
* Generous PTO, annual sick days, and paid holidays
* CME allowance and reimbursement for CDS/DEA, licensing, and boards
* Tuition reimbursement for advanced degrees
* Outstanding growth & mentorship opportunities

  
**Qualifications**

* Bachelors & Master’s degree required
* NP License in NJ required
* ACLS and BLS required
* 3-5 years’ experience as a nurse practitioner preferred
* Must have excellent communication and computer skills
Strong work ethic and a team player who can work independently

title: Call Center Agent
description:
Who we are:


Spire Orthopedic Partners is a growing national partnership of orthopedic practices that provides the support, capital and operational resources physicians need to grow thriving practices for the future. As a Management Services Organization (MSO), Spire provides the infrastructure for administrative operations that allows practices to operate at their highest level, so doctors can focus their efforts on what matters most patient care. Headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut, Spire Orthopedic Partners is a growing partnership of orthopedic practices that provides the support, capital and operational resources physicians need to grow thriving practices in todays evolving healthcare landscape. The Spire network spans the Northeast with more than 165 physicians, 1,800 employees, 285 other clinical providers and 40 locations in New York, Connecticut, Rhode Island and Massachusetts.


What youll do:


Responsibilities/Duties:

* Serves as initial point of contact through our call center to register all new patients and direct current patients - utilizing skills of tact, compassion, and confidentiality in a professional manner.
* Manage calls from patients requiring medical care and provide / gather information needed.
* Take electronic messages and convey information to respective medical care providers.
* Screen and transfer calls to the appropriate person/department.
* Assign pending documents into a patients chart within the EMR system.
* Other duties as assigned by managers and leads.


Who you are:


Qualifications:

* High school Diploma or equivalent.
* One year of medical experience. Health care receptionist or call center experience preferred.
* HIPAA and other Insurance regulations, policies, and procedures.
* Medical office procedures, policies, practices and medical terminology.
* Electronic medical systems are a plus, including Athena/Centricity, Medi-Tech and the like.
* Strong communication skills, verbal and written.
* Extensive customer service experience.
* Computer skills, being proficient with Windows based software.
* Strong problem-solving skills.
* Ability to represent our organization in a professional manner.


What we offer:

* Excellent growth and advancement opportunities
* Dynamic environment
* Access to a diverse network of practitioners
* Broad infrastructure of tools and programs to enhance the employee experience
* Competitive Compensation
* Generous PTO
* Benefits package: health, dental, vision, 401(k), etc.


We are an equal-opportunity employer. Qualified Applicants are considered for positions and are evaluated without regard to actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex, or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances (referred to as protected characteristics).

description:
