title: Floating Assistant Teacher - New Hyde Park
description:
**Floating Assistant Teacher**
------------------------------

**$16.50/hour**


-


Under the supervision of the Head Teacher and Center Director, the Assistant Teacher will be responsible for working within the framework of Harbor Child Care carrying out its functions, educational philosophy, policies and procedures including but not limited to:

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**:


The Assistant Teacher, under the supervision of the Head Teacher and Associate Teacher, is responsible for the planning and execution of a classroom program that takes into account the educational, social development and health needs of the group as well as the individual child. The Asst. Teacher is required to lift and carry children as well as be physically fit to actively participate in age appropriate activities for the class

**Duties and Responsibilities**

* Assists in developing a program of developmentally appropriate practices
* Upholds Harbors philosophy and policies, i.e. health & safety, nutrition and regulations as stated in the Parent Policy, New Employee Welcome Manual and Employee Handbook.
* Actively implements age appropriate The Creative Curriculum.
* Supports children during transition time.
* Responsible for supervision of children
* Supports and actively participates in an active work and outdoor time.
* Works with Head Teacher and Director concerning children with special needs.

**Record keeping**

**Reports**

* Write six week and twice yearly cumulative reports.

**Parent Relations**

* Fosters positive parent relationships through respecting the confidential nature of all information about parents and children.
* Uses Contact Notes for staff and parent concerns.

**Self-Evaluation**

* Assumes responsibility for discussing his/her professional performance objectively at regularly scheduled supervisor conferences with the Assistant Director or Director using these conferences as a source of information and professional guidance.

**Training****/Meetings**

* Attends required trainings and workshops
* H.S. Diploma
* Must have experience working with infants ages 3months to 5 years old.

title: Center Director - New Hyde Park
description:
**Job Title:** Early Childhood Center Director

**Location:** New Hyde Park

**Employment Type:** Full-time

**Reports To:** Executive Director

**Job Summary:**


We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Early Childhood Center Director to lead our early childhood education center. The ideal candidate will be passionate about early childhood education, possess strong leadership skills, and have a proven track record of managing a successful early childhood program.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Program Management:** Oversee the daily operations of the center, ensuring a safe, nurturing, and engaging environment for children.
* **Staff Leadership:** Recruit, hire, train, and supervise teaching and administrative staff. Provide ongoing professional development and conduct regular performance evaluations.
* **Curriculum Development:** Implement and oversee a developmentally appropriate curriculum that meets state standards and fosters the social, emotional, and cognitive growth of all children.
* **Compliance:** Ensure that the center complies with all local, state, and federal regulations, including licensing requirements and health and safety standards.
* **Family Engagement:** Build and maintain strong relationships with families, ensuring clear communication and collaboration. Address any concerns or issues promptly and effectively.
* **Financial Management:** Develop and manage the center's budget, including tuition collection, payroll, and expense monitoring. Identify opportunities for financial growth and sustainability.
* **Community Outreach:** Represent the center in the community, building partnerships with local organizations, schools, and agencies to enhance program offerings and support services.
* **Quality Assurance:** Regularly assess program quality and implement improvements to ensure excellence in early childhood education.

**Benefits:**

* Health, dental, and vision insurance.
* Paid time off (PTO) and holidays.
* Professional development opportunities.
* Retirement plan options.
* **Education:** Bachelors degree in Early Childhood Education, Child Development, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
* **Experience:** Minimum of 5 years of experience in early childhood education, with at least 3 years in a leadership role.
* **Licensing:** Must meet all state requirements for a Child Care Director, including any required certifications.
* **Skills:** Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills. Ability to work collaboratively with staff, families, and the community.
* **Knowledge:** Deep understanding of early childhood development, curriculum planning, and state licensing requirements.
* **Certifications:** CPR and First Aid certification (or willingness to obtain).

title: Unarmed Security Guard
description:
Strategic Security (SSC) is a nationwide leading provider of security guard services, executive protection, bomb dog, intelligence, consulting, investigative services.


As an Unarmed Security Officer, you will be responsible for conducting unarmed foot patrol within a Government, corporate, retail or fast food environment, while providing superior service to customers, visitors and employees. Additional responsibilities include composing reports, monitoring CCTV and alarm systems, controlling access and egress, deterring criminal activity and misconduct, and performing other duties as needed. **This position is paying $18.00/hr.**  

  

In addition to providing physical security, this role will participate in SSC's G.E.T. principals. Greet, Engage and Thank individuals for their business or patronizing the location. These duties include:

* Welcome customers, guests, shoppers, victims, customers, associates, tenants in a warm, gracious manner inviting them into the location.
* Engage by being proactive, examples below.
* Proactively scan for potential threats stemming from criminal activity or life safety issues.
* Proactively seek out and develop rapport with customers by assessing what is important to them and addressing it
* Proactively stay current with the latest information as it pertain to your site and area that may include but not limited to: crime trends, terrorist threats, area shops, restaurants and attractions, including brand profiles, merchandise collections, promotions and current news.
* Watch for irregular or unusual conditions that may create security concerns or safety hazards
* Sound alarms or calls police or fire department in case of fire or presence of unauthorized persons
* Identify and warn violators of rule infractions, such as loitering, smoking or carrying forbidden articles
* Permit authorized persons to enter property and monitors entrances and exits. May be required to utilize hand held wands or walk through magnetometers.
* Prevent individuals from theft of company property
* Investigate and prepares reports on accidents, incidents, and suspicious activities; maintain written logs as required by the post
* Liaison with local law enforcement
* Share that information with customers or any of above when interactions with them require it
* Guide customers to their destinations or available open lines or other key points of interest
* Anticipate and answer customer inquiries. Know you job and local area
* Facilitate various guest services, including transportation and area attraction inquiries.
* Troubleshoot customer issues, concerns, or complaints; relay pertinent information to management
* Ensure job site area with your area of control is clean and professional at all times.
* Assist with basic first aid
* Make emergency notifications.
* Perform security patrols of designated areas on foot or in vehicle


Strategic Security (SSC) is a security provider for the United States Government, private organizations such as fortune 500 companies, solar and wind farms, oil and gas companies, banks, medical facilities, factories, warehouses, distribution centers, commercial facilities, residential communities and much more.  

  

As a full time employee of Strategic Security (SSC), you will be entitled to the following benefits:

* Major Medical
* Paid vacation
* 401K
* Opportunities for additional training to aid in your professional development


Strategic Security Corp. Employees are also entitled to the following perks of employment:

* Various discounts and access to exclusive deals with our corporate affiliates and partnerships including cell phone data plans, home goods and travel / entertainment
* Weekly pay periods
* Flexible scheduling (as available and will vary by location, management and company needs)


Strategic Security (SSC) offers job security with many of our jobs resulting in full time employment, excellent pay and benefits, and career opportunities. We offer entry level careers, management careers, sales careers and executive careers across the United States.

**Education, Licenses and Certifications Required**

* Must possess a high school diploma or equivalent
* Pass a State licensing test if driving a company-owned or client-provided vehicle
* Pass and possess a State Licensed Unarmed Security Guard Card / License if required by you State / City / Locality

**Experience Required**  

  

Verifiable work history if previously employed and must possess **one or more** of the following:

* Graduate of an accredited high school or a Certificate of Completion of General Education Development requirements; and meet one of the following experience / education requirements:
* Experience of 1 year as a security officer strongly preferred

 **Skills Required**

* Ability to follow orders
* Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Office
* Effective oral and written communication skills
* Active listening skills
* Ability to assess and evaluate situations effectively
* Ability to identify critical issues quickly and accurately
* Attention to detail

 **Other**

* Must be at least 18 years old or the minimum age required by the state, if higher
* Must be a U.S. citizen or a foreign citizen authorized to legally work in the United States
* Must be able to operate radio or telephone equipment and/or console monitors
* Must have demonstrated ability to interact cordially and communicate with the public
* Must be warm, engaging, charismatic; and possess a natural ability to develop rapport with others in an authentic and sincere manner
* Must practice good judgment; high level of integrity
* Must be proactive; take initiative with minimal supervision
* Must be resourceful; think critically and finds solutions even without the obvious resources
* Must be able to navigate challenging situations while remaining positive
* Subject to a drug screen to the extent permitted by law
* Must be able to provide, upon job offer, a DD214 discharge document with discharge status indicated, if prior military

 **Physical Requirements and Environment**  

  

**Environment:** Indoor and outdoor, temperature ranges from moderate to extreme cold and heat  

  

**Major activity:** Walking, standing, speaking, listening, observing  

  

**Physical efforts to carry out job duties:** Standing, walking, and sitting. Minimal to no stooping or kneeling.  

  

**About The Company**  

EOE Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity  

  

Strategic Security (SSC) is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and an Alcohol- and Drug-Free Workplace  

  

If you have any questions regarding Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action or Diversity and Inclusion, or have difficulty using the online system and require an alternate method to apply, please contact our Corporate Human Resources Department at (888) SSC-RISK.

title: Operations Billing Associate | Wealth Management
description:
Cerity Partners is seeking a talented, bright, and motivated individual with the highest level of personal integrity to join our Billing & Revenue Recognition Team as a Billing Associate. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work in a collaborative and fast- paced environment to prepare, execute and manage various client billing functions. The ideal candidate must have impeccable attention to detail and communication skills, as well as proven analytical and financial experience.


We stress the importance of everyones role on the team - we each have an important role to play that requires different levels of responsibility and a willingness to work closely with others in cross-functional areas to achieve a common goal.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Ensure all clients are set up accurately in the firms portfolio accounting systems
* Manage and execute quarterly billing runs
* Facilitate quarterly billing at major custodians
* Resolve billing issues and handle ad hoc billing requests
* Assist with preparing and sending billing to clients
* Work with Accounts Receivable team to ensure accuracy of all billing and payments
* Collaborate with the Billing, Finance, Operations and broader organization to improve processes
* Bachelors Degree in Finance, Accounting, or related business field
* 2-4 years of experience preferred
* Previous operations or finance experience which may include billing , account opening or reconciliation
* Strong proficiency with Microsoft Excel
* Experience working with a portfolio accounting system such as Orion or Addepar
* Highly detail oriented with the ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
* Identify with Cerity Partners mission and demonstrate our core values
* Ability to be a self-starter

**Company Overview:**


Cerity Partners is a leading, national registered wealth management and institutional consulting firm serving high-net-worth individuals and their families, businesses and their employees, and nonprofit organizations from its offices across the country. Our in-house experts of attorneys, tax advisors, financial planners and investment professionals are passionate about and committed to providing objective financial advice and oversight.


Our mission is to positively impact the financial well-being of our clients by delivering objective financial advice. Our culture allows us to deliver this mission. We believe in a simple formula that drives our actions and pushes us every day to do better than the day before: People First + Accountability = Winning Outcomes. We expect our team members to deliver on their responsibilities, understand how every component of our company works to generate success, and hold themselves and their colleagues accountable to the highest standards. As a result, we will enjoy talking to you if:

* You understand the need to provide a world-class client experience
* You value the collaboration of insightful, experienced colleagues to deliver our services
* You demonstrate a strong affinity in financial services, exceptional communication, organization, and prioritization skills


#LI-CH1
company_description: Our advisors utilize their experience and expertise and that of their colleagues to develop the best solutions for your complex personal and professional financial situations.

title: Marketing and Social Media Internship
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE & THE COMPANY: This is an intern role eligible for school credit. Interns not seeking school credit are eligible based on need, for a $100 per week stipend. All interns are expected to be passionate about New York's fashion industry. The New York fashion industry is synonymous with the speed of the city itself. New York is famously known as the city that never sleeps, and its fashion industry is no exception. Hence, our extremely fast-paced work environment, that is constantly evolving, as our operation runs 24/7. Our team is a close-knit group with a bond strengthened from constant team-building activities.

ABOUT THE BRAND: SHAO New York burst onto the fashion scene with a spectacular launch at New York Fashion Week 2023, instantly establishing itself as a cutting-edge, elevated streetwear brand. Our headline-making clothing caught the eye of industry insiders and fashion enthusiasts alike, propelling SHAO to immediate fame. With the strategic assistance of PR powerhouse Kelly Cutrone and the buzz generated by association with media darling Anna Delvey, SHAO New York quickly became one of the most talked-about new brands in the industry.

Our designs push the boundaries of traditional streetwear, infusing it with high-fashion elements to create a unique, luxurious aesthetic. SHAO New York is not just about clothing; it's about making a statement, challenging norms, and redefining what streetwear can be. Each piece is designed to be a conversation starter, embodying the bold, unapologetic spirit of New York City.

Since our dramatic entrance into the fashion world, SHAO New York has continued to innovate and surprise, maintaining our position at the forefront of the industry. We are committed to creating clothing that is not only visually striking but also emblematic of the cultural zeitgeist, ensuring that SHAO remains a brand that's always one step ahead of the curve.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Contribute to omnichannel optimization.
* Assist with the evolution of our e-commerce platform.
* Facilitate tasks delegated like product advertising and placement.
* All team members journey to and from the Garment District, and handle deliveries.
* Comfortable visiting and communicating with businesses in the garment district.
* Assist with daily activities and tasks.
* Design and execute marketing content for email campaigns, social media advertisements and promotions, and other platforms that meet SHAO New York's branding objectives.
* Assist in planning and executing events, fashion shows, and photoshoots.

**REQUIREMENTS:**

* Currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree in a related field.
* Keen awareness of client experience and anticipation to client needs.
* Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Strong computer skills, specifically Excel, Photoshop, and Illustrator software.
* Highly organized, motivated, and a team player.
* Entrepreneurial spirit and ability to wear multiple hats.
* Willingness to go the extra mile.

Job Type: Internship

Pay: Up to $100.00 per week

Schedule:

* Day shift

Application Question(s):

* Do you want to tell us anything else about you that you did not convey in your cover letter?
* Please describe what interests you have in the fashion business, as well as who and what in fashion inspire you.
* After reading the description of this internship, what expectations do you have for this role?
* Based on a scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the best. Please rate your problem-solving skills, including troubleshooting software applications, and explain your self-rating.
* Based on a scale of 1 to 10, 10 being the best. Please rate your assertiveness, and explain your self-rating.

title: Nursing Assistant I, Full Time 11p -7a Med Surg D2, MMC
description:
Responsible for working alongside physicians and nurses and facilitating advanced primary and specialty nursing services. Provides patients with support through activities including, but not limited to bathing services, serving meals, transportation, administering medication, and positioning. Ensures patients and families have a positive experience by exhibiting alertness, collaboration, teamwork, and a positive attitude.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

  

1. Supports nursing personnel in providing direct patient care and assists patients with daily activities.
  

2. Serves and collects food trays and provides between-meal nourishment.
  

3. Changes bed linen, runs errands and prepares and sterilizes treatment trays and supplies.
  

4. Transports patients within the facility for consultations, treatments, tests, or examinations.
  

5. Measures and records patients' vital signs such as temperature or pulse and provides basic treatment.
  

6. Ensures a safe care environment for the patients and their families.
  

7. Performs continuous rounds and check-ins throughout the shift to ensure patient and family needs are met.
  

8. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
**Minimum Education:**

* High School Diploma or GED required

**Minimum Experience:**

* Nursing Assistant experience
* Acute, long term, rehab experience preferred

**License/Certifications:**

* BLS preferred
* CNA preferred

  
ABOUT US


At Atlantic Health System, our promise to our communities is; Anyone who enters one of our facilities, will receive the highest quality care delivered at the right time, at the right place, and at the right cost. This commitment is also echoed in the respect, development and opportunities we give to our more than 20,000 team members. Headquartered in Morristown, New Jersey, we are one of the leading non-profit health care systems in the nation. Our facilities and sites of care include:


* Morristown Medical Center, Morristown, NJ
* Overlook Medical Center, Summit, NJ

We also have more than 900 community-based healthcare providers affiliated through Atlantic Medical Group. Atlantic Accountable Care Organization is one of the largest ACOs in the nation, and we are a member of AllSpire Health Partners.


We have received awards and recognition for the services we have provided to our patients, team members and communities. Below are just a few of our accolades:

title: Physical Therapy Aide
description:
Position Summary:


Our Therapy Aides are valued members of our clinic team. They ensure the equipment and clinic remain safe and clean for our patients, provide support to our front office team such as answering phones, collecting copays, checking in patients, and communicating with the patients and their family members. This is a great opportunity for students who are pursuing exercise science, physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy or anyone who loves being in healthcare and helping others.
Join Ivy Rehab’s dedicated team where you’re not just an employee, but a valued teammate! Together, we provide world-class care in physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, and applied behavior analysis (ABA) services. Our culture promotes authenticity, inclusion, growth, community, and a passion for exceptional care for every patient.


Job Description:

**Physical Therapy Aide**

Why Choose Ivy?

* **Best Employer:** A prestigious honor to be recognized by Modern Healthcare, signifying excellence in our industry and providing an outstanding workplace culture.
* **Innovative** **Resources & Mentorship:** Access to abundant resources, robust mentorship, and career advice for unparalleled success.
* **Professional Development:** Endless opportunities for career advancement through training programs centered on administrative excellence and leadership development.
* **Exceeding Expectations:** Deliver best-in-class care and witness exceptional patient outcomes.
* **Incentives Galore:** Eligibility for full benefits package beginning within your first month of employment. Generous PTO (Paid Time Off) plans, paid holidays, and bonus incentive opportunities.
* **Exceptional Partnerships:** Collaborate with leaders like Hospital for Special Surgery (HSS) to strive for excellence in patient care.
* **Empowering Values:** Live by values that prioritize teamwork, growth, and serving others.
  

 Position Qualifications:

* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a positive attitude.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and bedside manner.
* Outstanding time management and ability to multi-task.
* Proven exceptional customer service and patient care experience.
* Self-motivated with the drive to exceed patient expectations.
* Flexibility to work varied shifts and possible weekends.

Actual salaries depend on a variety of factors, including experience, specialty, education, and organizational need. Any listed salary range or contractual rate does not include bonuses/incentive, differential pay, or other forms of compensation or benefits.*

title: Principal IT Strategy Analyst
description:
**Requisition**: 78893


**PSEG Company:** PSEG Services Corp.

**Salary Range**: $ 101,600 - $ 160,900

**Incentive**: PIP 15%

**Work Location Category**: Hybrid

  

PSEG operates under a Flexible Work Model where flexible work is offered when job requirements allow. In support of this model, roles have been categorized into one of four work location categories: onsite roles, hybrid roles that are a blend of onsite and remote work, remote local roles that are primarily home-based but require some level of purpose-driven in-person interaction and living within a commutable distance, and remote non-local roles that can be effectively performed remotely with the ability to work in approved states.


We want you to be healthy, balanced, and feel secure. That’s why you’ll enjoy a comprehensive range of benefits, with a focus on supporting your whole health. Starting on day one of your employment, you’ll be offered several health-related benefits including medical, vision, dental, and well-being and behavioral health programs. We also offer 401(k) with company match, company paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement and a minimum of 18 days of paid time off per year.


PSEG offers a unique experience to our more than 12,000 employees – we provide the resources and opportunities for career development that come with being a Fortune 500 company, as well as the attention, camaraderie and care for one another you might typically associate with a small business. Our focus on combatting climate change through clean energy technology, our new net zero climate vision for 2030 and enhanced commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion; and supporting the communities we serve make this a particularly exciting time to join PSEG.


**Job Summary**
---------------


A Principal Strategy Analyst is responsible for analyzing and evaluating an organization's overall business strategy and performance. Their role includes the collection, research and analysis of IT-related data, processes and strategies to discover trends for continuous improvement and peak performance. They will be expected to manage insights and recommendations for improvement in tools, metrics and processes to ensure alignment with IT strategy. The Principal Strategy Analyst is expected to communicate with senior leadership regularly and support the development of a long-term organizational strategy.

**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------

* Become the UNITE Core Team Member, which is the primary point of contact for UNITE at PSEG. UNITE (Utility Information Technology Best Practices Program) is an information technology benchmarking and best practices consortium initiated by Southern Company Services. Some responsibilities as a UNITE Core Team Member as documented in the UNITE Governance Model includes ensuring information exchanges include the correct subject matter experts (SMEs) and occur within the proper timeframe; coordinating and collecting PSEG data for benchmarking; creating and managing a full internal project plan for UNITE data collection participation.
* Become the UNITE Survey Coordinator, which is responsible for overseeing the survey process at PSEG.
* Collect, research and analyze data and reports on IT strategy and performance, including but not limited to IT operational metrics, tools, and procedures. Use external resources and build working relationships across the industry to gather data and information timely and accurately. Prepare presentations and reports for senior leadership extracting key themes and outlining recommendations for next steps. Present on insight and provide input on the material collected for continuous improvement.
* Maintain and continuously improve IT's strategic processes and materials for maximum benefit, including the facilitation of strategy sessions and ongoing interactions with the business and other Service Company organizations. Become a leader within our peer groups across the industry as well as resource within IT that project and continuous improvement teams can leverage for information.
* Create and maintain an annual benchmarking plan that includes presenting regular updates to IT SLT and other senior leaders, and providing a monthly or YE report with research and best practices that tie to IT strategy (for example, a monthly summary of UNITE surveys).
**Job Specific Qualifications**
-------------------------------


Required (Education, Experience, Skills, Knowledge):  

* Bachelors’ degree in business, finance, management, or another analytical field
* A minimum of 8 years’ experience in analytical, quantitative, and qualitative analysis
* Hands-on experience with MS products and data visualization tools (e.g., Excel, PowerPoint, Power BI)
* Advanced experience in data mining, query and report design with the ability to create a product that can be shared with many types of audiences
* Experience with predictive analytics tools and techniques
* Ability to develop new approaches with applicable tools to measure success
* Detail oriented, driven and able to effectively work independently
* Work well with limited supervision while being responsible for project management, compliance assurance and risk mitigation
* Ability to work effectively across department boundaries and maintain positive relationships with cross functional partners
* Experience collaborating with and providing thought leadership to executive leadership teams
* Experience prioritizing and managing multiple and technically complex assignments concurrently
* Maintain flexibility and readily adapt to dynamic priorities
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Comfortable with public speaking and giving presentations to a variety of audiences and facilitating process improvement teams
* Must foster an inclusive work environment and respect all aspects of diversity

Additional Critical Information:  

* PSEG will not offer visa sponsorship or relocation in connection with these positions.

Desired:  

* Master’s degree
* Experience in industry benchmarking groups and studies
**Minimum Years of Experience**
-------------------------------


8 years of experience**Education**

Bachelors**Certifications**

title: Manager - US Consumer Investment Optimization- Finance
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.



Our industry is rapidly evolving, and we need courageous, quick thinkers who can shape the strategic decisions that lead our business forward. Whether it’s negotiating with some of our largest global partners or creating next year’s financial plan, you can influence both our day-to-day P&L and the future direction of the company. As part of the team, you can have the opportunity to learn and use the latest data tools and technologies and explore a range of roles to grow your career. Find your place in finance on #TeamAmex.



As part of the broader US Consumer Finance team, the US Consumer Investment Optimization team provides decision support to the Marketing team through evaluation and prioritization of prospect, customer and digital investments. This team works closely across US Consumer Finance, Marketing, and Investment Management Services to develop and access the impact of key marketing strategies of the Business Unit’s largest investment pool.


**How will you make an impact in this role?**



This Manager position will primarily focus on monthly decision support and planning for US investments. The manager will drive the monthly reporting and forecasting process, and analyze investment data in order to make funding recommendations for the US. The manager will be heavily involved in planning processes, executive reviews, and key business partner support. In addition to supporting the IO function, there will be a significant focus on driving innovation in measuring investment returns and enhancing investment reporting capability. This is an excellent opportunity for an individual to gain deep knowledge of the US Consumer Services business model and the card member acquisition process.



Strong attention to detail, ability to collaborate effectively, analytical bend of mind and clear communication skills will be key for success in this role.


**Responsibilities include:**


* Collaborate with Marketing and Finance on investment management ranging from campaign management/ funding and related partner negotiations to monthly/ quarterly budget allocations and managing the P&L risks and opportunities.  

Collaborate with Investment Management Services to analyze and communicate monthly performance review, reporting and analytics.
* Liaise and collaborate with Global IO team to understand overall P&L impacts as well as help support official planning/forecasting processes.
* Provide insight into investments optimization and decisioning, including driving investment efficiencies.
* Analyze the impact of different prospect/customer segment initiatives and acquisition/customer marketing programs.
* Partner with the business on recommended changes to optimize financial returns.
* Manage complex processes and ambiguous situations collaborating with multiple teams


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Solid understanding of financial statements, and valuation skills (DCF, ROI, etc.); any card economics knowledge a plus.
* 4+ years of experience in Investment Optimization, or related field
* Exceptional analytical skills and ease with complex data sets, including advanced Excel and programming knowledge a plus (SQL preferred).
* Demonstrated excellent strategic thought leadership skills, as well as strong financial and analytical skills.
* Ability to create and maintain financial and economic models.
* MBA or similar professional degree required.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Self-starter, strong organization skills.
* Highly motivated individual with desire to work on ambiguous projects and the ability to break down complex ideas into understandable and actionable messages.
* Ability to build relationships with business partners, and influence decisions with sound logic and analytics.
* Clear communication skills – verbal, written and through presentations.
* Ability to break down complex ideas into understandable and actionable messages.
* Effectively manages multiple priorities and tight deadlines.


Salary Range: $80,000.00 to $155,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits



The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.



Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.



We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


* Competitive base salaries
* Bonus incentives
* 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
* Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
* Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
* Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
* 20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
* Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
* Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
* Career development and training opportunities


For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.



American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.



We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Vice President, Global Commercial Services, U.S. SME Specialty Teams
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.



American Express is a leading global payments, network, and travel company, backed by one of the world's most recognized brands. American Express is unique in the payments industry as an issuer of card, non-card solutions, and a worldwide network that processes millions of merchant transactions daily. With over 160 years of innovation behind us, our future could not look more promising. We are moving faster than ever and introducing new products, services, and strategies to bring greater value to our business customers. American Express supports business owners with products and services to help them run and grow their businesses. We are committed to delivering differentiated value to businesses through our wide range of products and services, giving American Express Card Members a competitive edge.

  



American Express is the leading payment card issuer for small businesses in the United States and supports business owners with products and services to help them run and grow their businesses. Global Commercial Services (GCS) is committed to service and innovation and offers our Commercial Card Members a wide range of differentiated products and services. GCS is a core operating group of American Express and has delivered robust growth over the past decade. GCS partners with small businesses and corporate clients to help them manage business expenses and make large purchases through proprietary payment solutions and expense management tools. The U.S. SME Specialty Teams business is a fast-growing B2B payments business with differentiated non-card payment offerings.

  


  

The Vice President, AP Automation Sales leads a sales consultant team predominantly in the tele sales channel focused on acquiring and growing US companies with annual revenues of $10M - $300M leveraging a suite of accounts payables solutions. Specifically, the VP, AP Automation Sales will be responsible for accelerating the growth of these AP Automation solutions as both a proportional and incremental part of sales in the US Middle Market. The APA Sales Consultants are responsible for sourcing, qualifying, signing, and growing Accounts Payable software solution programs and deals. Our customers use our platform to manage their automated payments for goods and services. The sales focus is on driving incremental charge volume growth through partner channels focus on either managing existing or acquiring net new customers through regionally focused Account Development and Field Sales teams plus national, dialogically managed portfolios.

  





**Job Responsibilities:**



* History of overcoming both internal and external obstacles to drive major results.


* History of working with central business teams to act as voice of customer, working to identify and resolve issues.


* History of demonstrating the ability to design an executable strategy and go to market plan.


* Strong Strategic Acumen, ability to innovate and thrive in change

  


**Success in Financial Management Solutions and Sales Delivery**



* History of success in a client facing, in person/tele sales role, with skills including but not limited to gaining access, consultative sales, closing large and complex deals.


* Track record of success leading F2F customer and prospect sales teams that drive growth through a consultative sales process. Gains a commitment from the client to move forward by asking for the business and successfully managing objections.

  


**Market, Industry, & Product knowledge**



 * Modern payments, AP automation and expense management knowledge.
* This leader will be highly capable in both AP automation, expense management and payment solutions, while also exhibiting the sales & strategic thinking skills to define sales processes and product improvement.
* Understands at a tactical level market/ industry key competitors, challenges, terminology, technology, trends, and regulations.
* Possesses enough expertise on the full suite of American Express products and tools to consult on how they fit with the suite of AMEX AP automation and expense management solutions.

  


**Sales Leadership Skills**



Someone who has a proven history of leading a team and developing sales professionals by mentoring them on the following behaviors

  



 Demonstrating value



o Proactively and consistently demonstrates the value of partnering with Amex, highlighting key pillars of the value proposition.



o Documents and communicates the ROI of growth opportunities, identifying benefits and synergies with current products.



o Collaborate with SME Field and Dialogic based Account Development and Sales teams to prospect partner portfolios, prioritize growth opportunities, and win automated payments volume with a customer first mindset to meet or exceed sales targets

  



 Results focus



o Demonstrates a competitive, positive, “driven” attitude, quickly adapts to different situations, and recovers from setbacks.



o Proactively focuses on results, outcomes, and achievements, persistently overcoming obstacles as they arise.



o Tailor dialogic team sales strategies, follow rules of engagement to partner, and coach on specific methods to achieve sales targets

  





Influence & persuasion



o Uses appropriate interpersonal styles and communication methods to gain acceptance for products and/ or services.



o Utilizes innovativeness and compelling rationale to overcome complex client barriers, enabling mutually beneficial outcomes.

  



Account management & pipeline management



o Co-manages a pipeline of opportunities, leveraging client data/ analytics to plan and prioritize activities within small and large portfolios.



o Articulates top-funnel through bottom-funnel activities in clear and concise manner with the ability to forecast future outcomes.

  



Collaboration with Key Stakeholders



o Experience in working with multiple internal shareholders to drive a strategic plan.



o Experience in partnering and collaborating with different business unit teams to make the best decision outcomes.



o Experience influencing internal shareholders to align and deliver on shared and differentiated outcomes.



o Experience collaborating and setting expectations with external partners.

  





Colleague & Talent Management


o Experience managing, developing and coaching colleagues to perform against sales metrics.



o Demonstrated skill set of managing a robust performance development process.



o Experience elevating and recognizing high-performing colleagues.

  

Location is Virtual/hybrid with preferred locations of Atlanta, Phoenix, Ft. Lauderdale, or New York City. Role will require minimum of 40% travel. Bachelor’s degree required.

  



Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for this position.

  



Salary Range: $185,000.00 to $260,000.00 annually + bonus + equity (if applicable) + benefits


The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

* Competitive base salaries
* Bonus incentives
* 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
* Free financial coaching and financial well-being support

The U.S. Consumer Services Team is responsible for our suite of consumer products, services, and experiences in the U.S., including our premium, cobrand, cash back, and lending portfolios, Membership Rewards, Global Travel & Lifestyle Services, the Centurion Lounge network, our Global Dining and Resy businesses, U.S. Consumer Banking, and best-in-class marketing programs across customer, prospect, and partner channels. The USCS team is focused on making membership an indisputable competitive advantage and helping each other become better leaders every day.


The Executive Admin Assistant is a critical member of U.S. Consumer Services Control Management team who provides organizational support, ensures the team’s logistical needs are met, and helps to promote a positive atmosphere and work culture. If you are a highly pro-active individual with strong organization and interpersonal skills, and who thrives in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we strongly encourage you to apply for this role. The successful candidate will be responsible for day-to-day administrative support for two to three vice presidents (VPs) including calendar, travel, and expense management. In addition, they will support each VP’s teams on personnel-related tasks including onboarding and offboarding of colleagues, supply management, and other ad-hoc projects such as colleague engagement.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Responsible for calendar management on a daily, weekly and monthly basis for multiple VPs
* Manage meeting logistics (in-person and Webex)
* Manage general follow-ups to effectively meet deadlines and commitments
* Work closely with the other administrative assistants on office operations
* Maintain headcount reporting, organizational charts, and department distribution lists
* Organize internal and external business meetings, making all necessary arrangements including sending invites, reserving rooms, Webex setup, and arranging catering
* Ensure timely preparation and processing of expense reports
* Manage travel arrangements, as needed
* Other ad hoc administrative work, as needed


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Ideal candidate will have previous experience as an Executive Assistant
* Excellent calendar management skills
* Ability to quickly adapt and be flexible in a dynamic workplace
* Ability to effectively deal with a broad range of contacts and personalities – internal and external
* Strong sense of integrity with ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion
* Exceptional organizational, administrative and interpersonal skills
* Ability to prioritize multiple tasks with minimal guidance, solution-oriented
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Extremely thorough with a high level of attention to detail and quality; timely follow up
* Proven team player with ability to collaborate across groups and influence others
* Experience in providing support remotely to a geographically disbursed team
* Positive, can-do attitude

title: Resy Analyst, Restaurant Partnerships
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.



The U.S. Consumer Services Team is responsible for our suite of consumer products, services, and experiences in the U.S., including our premium, cobrand, cash back, and lending portfolios, Membership Rewards, Global Travel & Lifestyle Services, the Centurion Lounge network, our Global Dining and Resy businesses, and best-in-class marketing programs across customer, prospect, and partner channels. The USCS team is focused on making membership an indisputable competitive advantage and helping each other become better leaders every day.



Resy is the American Express global dining platform and sits within the USCS organization. Our mission is to connect the world's best restaurants with the world's best customers through a trusted and innovative` global SaaS platform, built on the promise of access and unforgettable experiences.



Resy's SaaS platform offers a wide range of features and functionality, managing reservations and tables, and tracking guest and restaurant data to help restaurants deliver the best hospitality to diners. Diners can discover the amazing world of restaurants thanks to our content-rich website and innovative mobile app. Our diners and Card Members are insiders, and we love having them at the table.

  


**ABOUT THE ROLE****:**

  



Resy is looking to add an Analyst to the Restaurant Partnerships team. The primary function of the Analyst, Restaurant Partnerships role is to empower and support the relationship managers’ ownership of the high-touch segment of our ResyOS restaurant base. The Analyst provides data analysis, resource curation, and thought leadership to support the day-to-day of our department, needs for servicing our partners, and performance reporting for our business unit. This role will earn a deep understanding of the Restaurant Partnerships’ book of business and be a knowledgeable asset that may assist with coverage needs or servicing gaps.



The Analyst should be a resource to and work with stakeholders across the Restaurant Partnerships team and Leadership. The Analyst’s insights may help guide the strategy & tactics for our internal business and for our partner relationships. This role requires close collaboration with Finance, Product Research, Enablement, RevOps, B2B & B2C Marketing, Data, and Strategic Partnerships Teams.

  


***Candidates should reside in New York, NY, and are required to go into our offices three days per week******.***

  


**WHAT YOU'LL DO :**

  


* Monitor and reconcile inventory for AMEX Global Dining Access program, analyze fulfilment, and help establish ROI for partner participation
* Act as logistics lead for partner programming and experiential opportunities, pulling through partner-facing success metrics
* Review Partner Value assessments (Partner Value Scores, Health Scores) and provide recommendations
* Perform audits to ensure seamless business operations and clean records
* Assist with Partner Satisfaction Survey logistics and analysis
* Analyze effectiveness of Success Plans and Business Reviews for scaled and replicable playbook recommendations
* Produce and deliver department performance metrics to various stakeholders across the org (Partner Satisfaction Surveys, End of Month, End of Quarter analyses, etc.)
* Create and manage analytics reporting for partner servicing
* Research and report on city- and partner-focused information
* Help create and maintain internal SOPs and assets for Restaurant Partnerships department

  


**WHO YOU ARE :**

  


* 1+ years in a hospitality, data analysis, or customer success role
* Restaurant or Hospitality experience preferred
* Excellent written and verbal communications
* Exceptional organization and time-management are critical to this role
* Experience with data analysis tools strongly preferred (i.e. Looker, Tableau, Excel)
* Experience with Salesforce, MS Office Suite, iOS, Atlassian a huge plus

 *Resy is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity through attracting and retaining a diverse team of employees and creating an inclusive environment for all. We do not discriminate on basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

title: Head Men's & Women's Tennis Coach- Part-time
description:
The Part-Time Head Coach is responsible for organizing, developing and administering an intercollegiate program for Men’s and Women’s Tennis in compliance with the rules and regulations of the department, the university, the NCAA Division III, the Middle Atlantic Conference, and any other organization or association in which the department may hold membership. The incumbent is also responsible for the recruitment of qualified student-athletes within university and NCAA Division III guidelines.
Required Qualifications:
1. Baccalaureate degree or equivalent related work experience.
2. Two years prior experience coaching and/or playing Men’s and Women’s Tennis, preferably on the intercollegiate level.
3. Knowledge of NCAA Division III rules and regulations a plus.
4. Commitment to support the academic progress and development of student athletes.
5. Evidence of recruiting success in (insert designated sport) programs.
6. Strong communication skills to enhance effective interaction with students, recruits, administrators, alumni and the community.
7. Must have a First Aid and CPR certification or obtain them during the 90 day Introductory Period. National Red Cross Certification preferred.
8. Must be willing to travel and be available to work flexible hours including nights and weekends as required.
9. Valid driver’s license and an acceptable driving record in accordance with the university’s Motor Vehicle policy. A MVC check will be required at the time of hire and thereafter as deemed appropriate by the university. Candidates for hire will be required to sign a waiver authorizing the MVC check.
10. Employment is contingent upon a satisfactory background check. Candidates for hire will be required to sign a waiver authorizing the background check and produce a Social Security Card.
Preferred Qualifications: Hours Worked
Heavy non-traditional hours with some weekends, nights and holidays included.

title: Manager-Compliance
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.



How we serve our customers is constantly evolving and is a challenge we gladly accept. Whether you’re finding new ways to prevent identity fraud or enabling customers to start a new business, you can work with one of the most valuable data sets in the world to identify insights and actions that can have a meaningful impact on our customers and our business. And, with opportunities to learn from leaders who have defined the course of our industry, you can grow your career and define your own path. Find your place in risk and analytics on #TeamAmex.



This position will play a meaningful role within the Line of Business Compliance team supporting Resy & Global Dining which has multiple web and mobile apps and will be responsible for providing advisory and compliance oversight for this area. The position will provide strategic support to drive innovation for the business while building an effective framework for compliance with applicable laws and regulations for U.S. and international markets. Focus will be dedicated to Resy & Global Dining product development, marketing strategies, process controls, customer communications and complaints.


**How will you make an impact in this role?**


* Provide resolution compliance support to assist business partners reach their goals while meeting compliance requirements.
* Review marketing campaign strategies and advertising materials to effectively mitigate compliance risks and provide regulatory guidance.
* Drive implementation of policy and regulatory requirements in the areas of Consumer Protection and Fairness, UDAAP, Third Party Management and other relevant federal, state, and local regulations.
* Support new initiatives through the New Product Approval (NPA) process and integration of effective controls, testing and ongoing monitoring into new and existing processes.
* Effectively manage the Corrective Action process to support timely closure of gaps and customer remediation where required.
* Strong focus on controls and processes with the ability to analyze and implement effective processes.
* Develop and maintain strong working relationships with business partners and internal collaborators (e.g., other Global Risk and Compliance colleagues, General Counsel’s Organization, Operational Excellence, Independent Compliance Testing, Privacy, Internal Audit Group)


**Minimum Qualifications**


Demonstrated proficient knowledge of U.S Consumer closed and open-end credit laws and regulations and banking regulations governing credit card activities and their impact on products, operations, and services.


* Experience with dining benefits and booking platforms preferred.
* Experience with digital Mobil products and hospitality platforms.
* Ability to research, assess and determine regulatory impact to business initiatives.
* Strong leadership skills and proven track record to influence decisions, communicate and collaborate effectively at all levels of the organization.
* Strong people skills to support business partners and a proven ability to develop and grow relationships.
* Ability to effectively communicate compliance risks and requirements to all levels of staff and management; including the ability to influence others to achieve desired results.
* Demonstrated ability to make decisions independently, work well under pressure, meeting deadlines and manage multiple tasks while prioritizing work in a highly deadline-intensive environment.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Compliance, legal, or risk experience.
* Familiarity with consumer privacy regulations.


**Preferred Qualifications**


* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience preferred.

title: Operating Room Registered Nurse CWR - ORRN24-11429
description:
**Job Title:** Operating Room Registered Nurse CWR  

**Location:** Edison, NJ (Postal Code: 08818) [ONSITE ROLE]  

**Duration:** 3 Months


**Hours Per Week:** 36.00  

**Shift:** 12-hour shifts, 6:45 AM - 3:15 PM, Monday-Friday  

**Schedule Notes:** No weekends, no holidays, at least 3 on-call shifts per month


**Job Summary:**



The Registered Nurse (RN) - OR CWR is primarily responsible for applying the nursing process to the care of veteran patients undergoing surgical procedures in the operating room. This role includes ensuring appropriate documentation reflects assessment of patient needs, interdisciplinary treatment plans, clinical interventions, and evaluation of patients' responses to treatments. The RN will also assign and evaluate the work of non-nursing direct care providers assigned to the operating room.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Apply the nursing process to the care of patients undergoing surgical procedures.
* Ensure documentation accurately reflects patient assessments, treatment plans, clinical interventions, and patient responses.
* Assign and evaluate the work of non-nursing direct care providers in the operating room.
* Provide care in specialties including Neurosurgery, Orthopedics, Robotic, or Endovascular Surgery.
* Scrub and circulate as needed during surgical procedures.
* Maintain a 1:1 patient ratio. Use Epic for documentation (preferred).
* Be available to work all days except those pre-disclosed prior to offer.
* Ensure work schedule is a priority with no conflicts from alternative jobs.


**Required Skills & Experience:**


* Minimum of 2 years of OR RN experience in at least one of the following specialties: Neurosurgery, Orthopedics, Robotic, or Endovascular Surgery.
* Scrub and circulating experience.
* BLS (AHA) certification.
* Highly reliable and available for all required shifts.


**Preferred Skills & Experience:**


* CNOR certification.
* Experience with Epic documentation.
* Experience in all four specialties: Neurosurgery, Orthopedics, Robotic, and Endovascular Surgery.


**Education Requirements:**


* ASN (Associate of Science in Nursing) required.
* BSN (Bachelor of Science in Nursing) preferred.


**Certifications & Licensure:**


* BLS (AHA) required.
* NIHSS certification.
* NJ State or compact RN license.


**Language Requirements:** English (Speak, Read, Write)



This position offers a rewarding opportunity to provide critical care to veteran patients in a surgical setting. If you have the required skills and experience, and are committed to providing high-quality patient care, we encourage you to apply.

title: Audit Manager - Learning and Development
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**
------------------------------------------



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.

Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.



IAG is a worldwide function with 300+ team members and offices across nine countries within American Express. We are committed to growing our audit staff significantly as we continue to expand and enhance the Internal Audit Group. Our assurance and risk professionals have diverse backgrounds including internal controls, consumer compliance, technology, operational risk, financial accounting, data analytics, and banking operations. Most IAG team members hold at least one professional certification. Our audit teams align to key risk areas and business units to ensure IAG can provide comprehensive and risk-based audit coverage. In addition, IAG has a Professional Practices group responsible for managing audit operations, quality, and standards; regulatory relations; reporting; training and professional development; and key internal capabilities and technologies.


Professional Practices – Training & Professional Development



The Internal Audit Group (IAG) provides internal training to colleagues in accordance with an established annual training plan. The trainings vary in nature between soft-skill and technical skill, with an emphasis on audit methodology and specific audit technical skills. IAG is seeking an experienced internal auditor to help design, develop and deliver audit methodology training to IAG colleagues and new hires. IAG is growing steadily over the next few years and therefore expects an increased need for focused new hire training and onboarding.



Key Responsibilities:

* Responsible for design, development and delivery of new hire audit methodology curriculum/programs
* Design, develop, and deliver audit-related training program components to diverse groups of auditors, who are geographically dispersed with varying levels of experience
* Responsible for the technical review of all training content to ensure respective material is in line with IAG methodologies prior to delivery
* Work closely with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to design, develop, and deliver meaningful training sessions. Develop tools and templates that SMEs can leverage when developing training programs
* Assist in the annual training needs analyses to inform and develop a formal department-wide training and development curriculum that is aligned with IAG’s audit specific needs
* Continuously enhance the Training & Professional Development Program to achieve the strategic objectives of the IAG Leadership team.
* Create communications for new and ongoing learning initiatives

**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------



* Strong training and facilitation skills
* Thorough knowledge and experience of internal audit methodologies
* Solid leadership skills
* 3+ years of experience in internal or external audit
* Experience delivering impactful training programs that effectively deliver on learning objectives and outcomes
* Strong PowerPoint and presentation design skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication
* Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills
* Bachelor degree in either accounting/finance


**Preferred Qualifications**
----------------------------


* Relevant professional certifications (CISA, CIA , CPA)

title: Girls Sports Coach - After School - Fall 2024
description:
Overview:  
Position is starting September 2024

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Sports Coach to join our team. As a Sports Coach, you will be responsible for providing instruction and guidance to students in various sports disciplines. This is a rewarding opportunity to make a positive impact on the lives of young athletes.

Duties:  
- Develop and implement training programs for students in a variety of sports, including Basketball, Baseball, Volleyball, Flag Football, Lacrosse and Soccer  
- Teach proper techniques, skills, and strategies to enhance performance  
- Provide individualized coaching and feedback to help students improve their abilities  
- Create a safe and inclusive environment for all participants  
- Manage behavior and ensure discipline during training sessions  
- Organize and supervise practice sessions.  
- Collaborate with other coaches and staff to coordinate schedules and events  
- Educate students on the importance of physical fitness and healthy lifestyle choices

Qualifications:  
- Previous experience working with students in a sports coaching or physical education role  
- Strong knowledge and expertise in multiple sports.  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  
- Ability to effectively manage behavior and maintain discipline in a group setting  
- Passion for working with children and helping them develop their athletic abilities  
- Certification or degree in sports coaching, physical education, or a related field is preferred  
- First Aid/CPR certification is a plus

Benefits:  
- Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications  
- Opportunities for professional development and growth within the organization

If you are passionate about sports coaching and have the skills to inspire young athletes, we encourage you to apply for this position. Please submit your resume along with a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience.

title: Bookkeeper
description:
A one-stop-shop for assessment testing and abatement of environmental hazards company is looking for a skilled bookkeeper to join their team! As a Bookkeeper, you will be responsible for recording all financial transactions, including purchases, sales, receipts and payments. Your job will include regular posting of information to accounting journals/software and reconciling accounts to ensure their accuracy.

**Responsibilities:**
---------------------

* Record day to day financial transactions and actively reconcile the accounts
* Complete the posting process
* Enter data, maintain records and financial statements
* Verify that transactions are recorded in the correct daybook, suppliers ledger, customer ledger, general ledger and other ledgers
* Complete all the tax forms
* Bring all the books to the trial balance stage
* Process accounts receivable/payable and accurately handle checks to vendors in a timely manner
* Other duties as assigned

**Requirements:**
-----------------

* Minimum 2 years of experience as a Bookkeeper
* Good understanding of basic bookkeeping and accounting payable/receivable principles
* Data entry skills along with a knack for numbers
* Hands-on experience with spreadsheets and QuickBooks Desktop/Online
* Ability to calculate, post and manage accounting and finance records
* Proficiency in English and in MS Office
* Attention to detail and accuracy
* BS degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration preferred
* Customer service orientation and negotiation skills
